description:
Business Analyst - NCAPS
Job Category: Information Technology
Time Type: Full time
Minimum Clearance Required to Start: None
Employee Type: Regular
Percentage of Travel Required: Up to 25%
Type of Travel: Continental US
* * *
The Opportunity:
CACI’s growing Agile Digital Solutions Operating Group is searching for an experienced Business Analyst who will be supporting the modernization and sustainment of a large portfolio of enterprise business solutions used by the National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA). You will be part of a team where complex problem solving, and communication skills are critical to success. If you are a motivated and detail-oriented Business Analyst with a passion for driving successful application and platform consolidation efforts, we encourage you to apply. Join our team and contribute to the transformation and success of our organization.
Responsibilities:
Collaborate with stakeholders, including product owners, development teams, and clients, to gather and analyze business requirements for the consolidation project.
Facilitate workshops and meetings to discover, document, and prioritize requirements, ensuring alignment with mission objectives and program goals.
Develop and maintain detailed business requirements, user stories, and acceptance criteria to guide the development teams.
Work closely with development teams during sprints to clarify requirements, provide feedback, and ensure the delivery of high-quality solutions.
Assist in the creation and maintenance of the product backlog, ensuring that it is prioritized and refined regularly.
Participate in sprint planning, daily stand-ups, sprint reviews, and retrospectives to ensure continuous improvement and effective delivery.
Support the testing process by understanding the most effective test scenarios and test cases and participating in user acceptance testing as a representative of the user community.
Act as a liaison between the business and technical teams to ensure a clear understanding of requirements and effective communication.
Identify and mitigate risks and issues related to requirements and scope, ensuring project success.
Contribute to the development and improvement of Agile practices and processes within the team and organization
You’ll Bring These Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree (will consider experience in lieu of education)
6 or more years relevant experience as a product owner, product manager, or business analyst, Strong knowledge of Agile methodologies, including Scrum, Kanban, and SAFe
Proven experience in gathering, documenting, and prioritizing business requirements and user stories.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with attention to detail.
Proficiency in Agile project management tools, such as JIRA, Confluence, or similar
Experience in conducting user acceptance testing and supporting the testing process.
Ability to adapt to changing project requirements and priorities in a fast-paced environment.
Thrive in a technically and geographically diverse environment
Must be willing to pass NASA background investigation and/or obtain a DOD Clearance (U.S. Citizenship Required)
These Qualifications Would Be Nice to Have:
Advanced degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
Certified Scrum Master (CSM), Certified Scrum Product Owner (CSPO), or other Agile certifications.
Experience in large-scale application and platform consolidation projects.
Knowledge of DevOps practices and tools, and their integration with Agile methodologies.
Experience in the public sector or government contracting environment.
Proficiency in data analysis and reporting tools, such as Excel, Power BI, or similar.
Strong understanding of software development life cycle (SDLC) and project management principles.
Excellent communication, facilitation, and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively with diverse teams and stakeholders.
Prior NASA experience
_____________________________________________________________________________
What You Can Expect:

A culture of integrity.
At CACI, we place character and innovation at the center of everything we do. As a valued team member, you’ll be part of a high-performing group dedicated to our customer’s missions and driven by a higher purpose – to ensure the safety of our nation.

An environment of trust.
CACI takes pride in fostering a diverse and accessible culture where every individual feels supported to chart their own path. You’ll have the autonomy to take the time you need through a unique flexible time off benefit and have access to robust learning resources to make your ambitions a reality.

A focus on continuous growth.
Together, we will advance our nation's most critical missions, build on our lengthy track record of business success, and find opportunities to break new ground — in your career and in our legacy.

Your potential is limitless. So is ours.
Learn more about CACI here.
_____________________________________________________________________________
Pay Range: There are a host of factors that can influence final salary including, but not limited to, geographic location, Federal Government contract labor categories and contract wage rates, relevant prior work experience, specific skills and competencies, education, and certifications. Our employees value the flexibility at CACI that allows them to balance quality work and their personal lives. We offer competitive compensation, benefits and learning and development opportunities. Our broad and competitive mix of benefits options is designed to support and protect employees and their families. At CACI, you will receive comprehensive benefits such as; healthcare, wellness, financial, retirement, family support, continuing education, and time off benefits. Learn more here.
Since this position can be worked in more than one location, the range shown is the national average for the position.
The proposed salary range for this position is:
$68,400-$143,700

description:
Position Summary:
This is a Hybrid position. Candidates must live within regular commuting distance to Houston, TX, 77064.

As a Business Analyst, you will play a critical role in understanding business processes, eliciting and documenting requirements, and collaborating with cross-functional teams to translate business needs into IT solutions. This position requires a strong blend of business acumen and technical expertise.
Tasks:
Essential functions
Collaborate with business stakeholders to identify and document detailed business requirements for IT projects and initiatives
Analyze and map current business processes, identifying opportunities for improvement and automation
Work with technical teams to design and propose IT solutions that align with business goals and requirements
Create clear and comprehensive functional specifications, user stories, and use cases that guide the development of IT solutions
Plan, coordinate, and conduct UAT activities, ensuring that IT solutions meet business needs and are free of defects
Analyze data to identify trends, patterns, and insights that inform business decisions and support data-driven strategies
Facilitate effective communication between business stakeholders and IT teams, ensuring mutual understanding and alignment on project objectives
Maintain accurate and up-to-date documentation of business requirements, process diagrams, and project artifacts
Support change management efforts by assisting in the development of training materials and providing user support during technology adoption
Collaborate with project managers and technical teams to ensure successful project delivery, including scope, timeline, and budget
Skills:
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
In-depth understanding of business analysis principles and methodologies.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and techniques.
Detail-oriented with a commitment to delivering high-quality work.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Eagerness to stay updated on emerging technologies and industry trends.
Experience and Education:
Bachelor's degree in information technology, computer science, business administration, or a related field
2+ years’ experience as an IT Business Analyst

Target salary range: $85k-95k. The estimate displayed represents the typical salary range for this position based on experience and other factors.
Business Analyst
Full Time
Location
Fort Eustis, VA
Position Overview
Overview:
The Business/Systems Analyst will primarily support the software development team with concentration on analysis and customer/product owner interaction related to existing and future Government systems. The successful candidate will utilize human centered design strategies as part of the completion of work assignments as they gather requirements, design/develop implementation recommendations, perform research and analysis, support the user experience, and create deliverables to the client. Examples of BA tasks to include the following: Course of Action briefs, use cases, test cases, user guides, online help files, and the facilitation of client meeting and client relationship management.
Responsibilities:
Requirements elicitation, conception, design, and development.
Interact with Subject Matter Experts and senior-level clients eliciting and defining requirements, modeling relationships between them, reusing requirements, and export/import requirements data for creating documentation.
Requirements management planning, managing the relationships between requirements, analyzing the impact of any changes and/or managing governance of same.
Support the implementation of changes to a web-based ‘system of systems’ portal consisting of a suite of highly complex interdependent and interconnected Microsoft .NET/C# web applications.
Apply understanding of client mission and needs to develop high-quality solutions that meets client expectations within an Agile Framework.
Support software release pre-deployment demonstration meetings with the client’s senior leadership as part of the larger change management effort.
Support Government Acceptance Testing including test cases, briefings, and communicating with development team based on users’ feedback.
Ability to use effective leadership and communication skills to influence others, gain agreement, and share abstract concepts.
Familiarity with some form of visual modeling i.e. Axure RP to ensure users have a clear understanding of processes and rules and can communicate these to other stakeholders or developers.
Use graphical tools and reports, interactive flows and simulations, dashboards, storyboards, and functionality for graphical models like UML or SysML models.
Assist in the development of various types of reports relating to standards and guides.
Perform extensive research and present findings via Course of Action (COA) presentations or PowerPoint slides.
Mandatory Requirement
Bachelor’s degree in a business-related field, BS in Computer Science preferred.
Applicant must be a U.S. Citizen to obtain and maintain an active Security Clearance.
Experience and Education
6-8 years of experience with requirements solicitation and stakeholder interaction.
Ability to mitigate risks when requirements, people, decisions, and timelines shift during a project.
Requirements traceability and impact analysis to include the ability to run test cases.
Understanding of relational data models and database structure is a plus.
DoDAF familiarity is a plus.
Knowledge of Enterprise Architecture, Operational Architecture, Data Architecture, Software Architecture, Business Process Reengineering, Data Modeling, Process Modeling is a plus.
Knowledge of Agile development paradigm – epic, feature, user stories, test cases - with associated tools is a plus.
Knowledge of human-centered design is a plus.
Knowledge of requirements management tools: JIRA, Confluence, SharePoint, Jama, Power BI, IBM Rational, Modern Requirements (Azure DevOPS) is desired.
Prior experience utilizing other tools for brainstorming or design: MS Visio, Mind Manager, MagicDraw, Text2MindMap, Mindmeister is a plus.
Self-motivated, driven, independent.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.

benefits: 401(k),Dental insurance,Health insurance,Paid time off,Union benefits,Vision
description:
OVERVIEW OF THE COMPANY
Fox Corporation
Under the FOX banner, we produce and distribute content through some of the world’s leading and most valued brands, including: FOX News Media, FOX Sports, FOX Entertainment, FOX Television Stations and Tubi Media Group. We empower a diverse range of creators to imagine and develop culturally significant content, while building an organization that thrives on creative ideas, operational expertise and strategic thinking.
JOB DESCRIPTION
As a Sr. Technical Business Analyst in the Business & Data Platforms organization, you will be responsible for working with internal and external partners to develop and document technical solutions including data flows, business processes, integrations, data processing logic. This role is focused on the ingestion, processing, enrichment, and downstream delivery of content / title metadata.
ABOUT YOU
Strong curiosity about our business: you are willing to ask questions, do research, and build a deep understanding of our business.
Innovative: you stay on top of industry developments, are passionate about technology, and look for ways to bring new ideas to our business.
Perseverance in the face of ambiguity or roadblocks: you are a problem solver who uses all resources available to understand the issues and propose a path forward.
Emotional intelligence: you can read the room, know when to speak vs. when to listen, and know that connecting personally with your colleagues delivers positive outcomes.
Bridge builder - you establish trusted and productive relationships with internal and external stakeholders, both business and technical.
Self-starter - you are oriented to growth and are a quick learner. You can work across multiple threads, with a good understanding of how to prioritize the tasks and activities you are working on.
A SNAPSHOT OF YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES
Lead requirements gathering with internal stakeholders including Product Management, Engineering, Site Reliability Operations.
Understand how Program, Schedule, and Rights data is used across the product landscape.
Lead solutioning and design workshops with internal stakeholders and external partners to create data flows, business processes, integrations, and data processing logic to meet requirements.
Translate requirements and proposals into user stories for development teams, test cases (including various edge cases) for QA teams, and process flows/SOPs for Operations teams.
Collect data points and perform process and technical analysis to better inform user stories and to troubleshoot.
Provide support to define and execute real-time change requests between business, programming, and integration teams.
Perform Salesforce Administration tasks to enable research, data cleansing/migration, release management.
Assist in the creation, development, and tracking of project work including software installations, configuration changes, feature enhancements, and data migration efforts.
Manage lower environments, UAT Refresh activities and post-refresh Salesforce administration tasks
Responsible for functional validation testing of new features and processes
WHAT YOU WILL NEED
Experience working as a Technical Business Analyst.
Strong knowledge, skills, and abilities with the Salesforce platform including declarative Salesforce configuration such as validation rules, process builder, flows, and object management.
Salesforce Administrator certification.
Strong understanding of integration and API patterns, including but not limited to: REST, SOAP, ETL, etc.
Comfort with common collaboration tools including but not limited to Lucidchart, Smartsheet, Salesforce, Slack, and Atlassian products (Jira & Confluence).
Demonstrated self-composure, low tolerance for process ambiguity, and personal + professional integrity.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to gather and interpret complex business requirements
Excellent written and oral communication skills with peers and leadership as demonstrated by documentation that is well organized and easy to comprehend.
NICE TO HAVE, BUT NOT A DEALBREAKER
Experience with SCTE 224 messaging.
Experience with the streaming, broadcasting, and/or entertainment industries.
Passion for sports and bringing compelling sports content experiences to viewers.
Familiarity with analytics frameworks and tools, such as Tableau.

Automation Jr. Business Analyst (Compleat)
Flight Centre Travel Group (FCTG) is one of the world’s largest travel retailers and corporate travel managers. The company, which is headquartered in Brisbane, Australia has company-owned leisure and corporate travel business in 23 countries, spanning Australia, New Zealand, the Americas, Europe, the United Kingdom, South Africa, the United Arab Emirates and Asia. FCTG also operates a global corporate travel management network, which extends to more than 90 countries through company-owned businesses and independent licensees. The company opened its first leisure travel shop in Sydney, Australia in 1982 and listed on the Australian Securities Exchange in 1995. Our purpose is to “open up the world for those who want to see”. Every day, we give people all around the world the opportunity to experience something really amazing – travel!
To learn more about Flight Centre Travel Group please click HERE
About The Opportunity
Technology plays an ever-increasing role in our industry; we are constantly looking at solutions to bring efficiency to the business and to our clients. As part of the larger Flight Centre Corporate Technology family, the FCM Mid-office team manages various aspects of automation programming on the COMPLEAT Control platform across the US, Canada, and LATAM regions.
The team is responsible for scoping requirements, developing and coding solutions, implementing them, testing the systems, and troubleshooting any issues that may arise. This assures a comprehensive approach to ensuring the smooth functioning of automated processes within FCM operations.
If being at the helm of driving new technology and efficiencies excites you and you desire to be an expert in an ever-changing environment, then this is the job for you!
This is a highly visible role and requires a mix of excellent technical, communication, presentation, testing, and customer service skills. You must be detail and result oriented, organized, resourceful and able to work autonomously. The ability to multi-task in a fast-paced customer-service focused environment is key. Be open to carrying out innovative new methods to gain speed in implementations through automation and process efficiencies. Part of this role will perform internal testing of programming before release to production to ensure we are good stewards of code based on documented

Gather comprehensive details on reported issues and new development requests and triage to appropriate 3rd level team

Ensure the service agreement between our company and the requestor is delivered in every interaction and in a way that ensures total client satisfaction and client retention
Testing code in a tester environment as well as off queue to assist developers before hand off to operations or technical delivery team

Above average Mid Office knowledge including pre QC, QC, pre ticket, auto ticket and post ticket
Above average Sabre GDS experience excelling in queue and PNR history
Some knowledge and experience working with OBTs - Concur, DEEM, Cytric
Excellent technical and client interaction skills

Experience in implementing and supporting Compleat Control platform preferred

title: Business Analyst

description:
- (3304694)

General Summary:
The Population Health Management (PHM) department at Mass General Brigham aims to deliver health and healthcare for all by translating the evolving needs of the healthcare landscape into innovative solutions to better serve individuals, communities, and organizations.
In the healthcare industry, we are in a time like no other. Experts estimate that healthcare will evolve more in the next few years than it has in the last 50 years. We have seen governments, employers, and families struggle in the face of rising healthcare costs and a fragmented healthcare system. Patients and communities need more convenient, more affordable, and higher quality care.
We are building a team that can reimagine healthcare and design care models that meet the needs of the people we serve. We are bringing a fresh perspective and a unique approach to create impact for the greater good. By bringing together people from various disciplines and ideas from different industries, we’re seeking to address the complex challenges within our healthcare system and leaning forward into a new era of healthcare.
We are seeking a skilled Business Analyst to join our team and play a crucial role in generating the insights required to succeed in value-based contracts. Reporting to the PHM Financial Planning Analytics Program Director, the Business Analyst will apply financial and analytical expertise to assess and optimize value-based care initiatives. This role will focus on conducting detailed financial analysis, developing cost containment strategies, and producing performance reports to drive improvements in value-based care contracts. The Business Analyst will work closely with claims and clinical data, utilizing expertise in data visualization tools and techniques to create actionable reports. Familiarity with Milliman MedInsight and Tableau is preferred but not required.
Principle Duties:
Data Analysis and Reporting: Analyze claims and clinical data to assess performance under value-based contracts. Generate and maintain reports and dashboards in Tableau and Excel to track key performance indicators (KPIs) and trends.
Contract Evaluation: Evaluate financial performance related to value-based contracts, including savings, costs, and quality metrics. Provide insights and recommendations for optimizing contract performance.
Data Integration: Work with cross-functional teams to integrate and validate data from various sources, including Epic and Milliman MedInsight, ensuring data accuracy and completeness.
Data Quality and Accuracy: Ensure high standards of data quality and accuracy in all analyses and reporting. Implement processes for data validation and address any discrepancies promptly.
Collaboration: Partner with clinical and operational teams to understand performance drivers and support data-driven decision-making. Communicate findings effectively to stakeholders at all levels.
Analytics Tools and Platforms: Utilize Milliman MedInsight for claims-based contract analytics and benchmarking. Employ Tableau and Excel to create interactive dashboards, reports, and financial models to present complex data in an accessible manner.

Qualifications:
Experience: 3+ years of experience in financial analytics and reporting within healthcare settings, with a focus on value-based care contracts. Experience analyzing claims and clinical (preferably Epic) required.
Technical Skills: Must be proficient in SQL, Excel, and PowerPoint. Tableau or PowerBI proficiency is preferred.
Education: Minimum bachelor’s degree in finance, healthcare administration, economics, business administration, or a related field with relevant experience. A master’s degree in business/health administration, public health, or economics is preferred.
Experience Substitution: A combination of education and experience may substitute for the above requirements.

Skills and Abilities:
Financial Analysis: Strong background in financial analysis, with experience in evaluating and optimizing value-based care contracts Ability to produce financial models to project contract performance and evaluate impact of population health initiatives.
Programming Skills: Proficiency in SQL.
Communication: Excellent interpersonal skills for effective communication with cross-functional teams and stakeholders. Ability to present complex financial findings to non-technical audiences. Must be proficient in PowerPoint.
Data Visualization: Experience with data visualization software (Tableau preferred) for creating insightful financial dashboards and reports.
Problem-Solving: Strong problem-solving skills, with the ability to develop and test hypotheses, and implement solutions in a fast-paced environment.
Independence and Teamwork: Capable of working independently and as part of a team, with a proactive and resourceful approach.
Attention to Detail: High attention to detail and commitment to accuracy in financial analysis and reporting.

EEO Statement

Mass General Brigham is an Equal Opportunity Employer. By embracing diverse skills, perspectives, and ideas, we choose to lead. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religious creed, national origin, sex, age, gender identity, disability, sexual orientation, military service, genetic information, and/or other status protected under law. We will ensure that all individuals with a disability are provided a reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment.

description:
Description:
O’Neill Vintners & Distillers is a proud member of the B Corp Certified community and one of the fastest-growing wineries in California. With operations in Larkspur, Parlier/Reedley, and Paso Robles, CA, we were founded with a simple idea from our founder, Jeff O’Neill: that great wines should be enjoyed by all. We believe those wines must be of exceptional quality centered around our core belief that doing the right thing for our employees, consumers, partners, and the planet is key to a sustainable future. Our award-winning portfolio of brands delivers on our core values, meeting consumers where they are. These brands include Line 39, Harken Chardonnay, Rabble Wines, Charles Woodson’s Intercept, FitVine Wine, Robert Hall Winery, Allegro Cellars, BrandyLab, and Javelin Vodka.

As an integral part of the Wine and Grape Supply (W&GS) team, you will engage with management and cross-functional teams to deeply understand our wine and grape supply position. You'll play a critical role in synthesizing this information to provide strategic insights. Your efforts will primarily focus on leveraging data analytics and upholding the highest standards of data management to inform decision-making and optimize business operations.
DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
The following reflects management’s definition of essential functions for this job but does not restrict the tasks that may be assigned. Management may assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time due to reasonable accommodation or other reasons.

Conduct in-depth analysis and reporting on supply and demand for grape-supplied businesses.
Manage and maintain extensive data sets, including the W&GS data warehouse, for robust analysis and strategic recommendations.
Design and refine data connections, queries, reports, and dashboards outside of enterprise systems (e.g., Excel).
Employ analytical methods and tools to interpret complex data, supporting informed decision-making and strategic planning.
Monitor industry trends and internal metrics to anticipate both immediate and long-term business needs.
Contribute to the development of the company's wine and grape supply strategy.
Collaborate in reviewing and improving departmental procedures and performance metrics, aligning them with business objectives.
Drive process enhancements by identifying inefficiencies and proposing data-driven solutions, contributing to ongoing business optimization.
Work with diverse teams across the organization to consolidate information, develop cohesive strategies, and ensure successful project execution.
Liaise with IT and other technical departments to define business requirements for data integration and reporting.
Develop and maintain analytical tools and frameworks to convert complex data into clear, actionable insights for strategic and operational decision-making.
Stay abreast of technological advancements, adopting new tools and techniques to enhance analytical capabilities and workflow efficiency.
Assist in integrating new system tools into the W&GS team’s workflow.
Conduct special financial and business studies as required.
Uphold satisfactory attendance, including timeliness.
Understand and comply with applicable quality, environmental, and safety regulatory considerations.
Requirements:
QUALIFICATIONS:
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below represent the knowledge, skill, and ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions.
Minimum Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree plus 2 years of experience in Accounting, Finance, or Data Analytics; or bachelor’s degree in relevant fields plus 1 year of experience; or High school diploma plus 6 years of relevant experience.
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel
Proficient in writing and debugging SQL queries.
Demonstrated experience in data management and analysis, with a clear understanding of data structures and database concepts.
Willingness to travel up to 5% of the time for onboarding, training, meetings, and events.
Preferred Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in relevant fields plus 2 years of experience in Accounting, Finance, or Data Analytics.
Experience with BI tools and dashboard development (MicroStrategy, PowerBI, or Tableau).
Familiarity with database platforms and management tools.
Strong analytical skills, with the ability to apply mathematical concepts and complex problem-solving strategies effectively.
Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills; capable of engaging effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Conflict resolution skills.
Adaptable to unexpected changes and a strong team player.
CULTURAL BEHAVIORS:
O’Neill team members are Forward Thinkers. Hard Working without Drama. Friendly Problem Solvers who work as One Team to Always Deliver.
PHYSICAL/MENTAL REQUIREMENTS:
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to do the following:
Sit for prolonged periods.
Perform some repetitive motion activities.
Coordinate multiple tasks simultaneously.
WORK ENVIRONMENT:
Work is normally performed in an office environment.
O’Neill Vintners & Distillers is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment, including the decision to hire, promote, discipline, or discharge, will be based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.
title: Business Analyst

job_title: Freelance Workday FINS and PSA Business Analyst
description:
WPP is the creative transformation company. We use the power of creativity to build better futures for our people, planet, clients, and communities.
Working at WPP means being part of a global network of more than 115,000 accomplished people in 110 countries. WPP has headquarters in New York, London and Singapore and a corporate presence in major markets worldwide.
We create transformative ideas and outcomes for our clients through an integrated offer of communications, experience, commerce, and technology.
WPP and our award-winning agencies work with most of the world's biggest companies and organisations – from Ford, Unilever and P&G to Google, HSBC, and the UN. Our clients include 61 of the FTSE 100, 307 of the Fortune Global 500, all 30 of the Dow Jones 30 and 62 of the NASDAQ 100. WPP are the leader in the Bloomberg Gender Equality Index and 20th in the FTSE 100 rankings for Women on Boards.
Why we're hiring:
At WPP, technology is at the heart of everything we do, and it is WPP IT's mission to enable everyone to collaborate, create and thrive. WPP IT is undergoing a significant transformation to modernise ways of working, shift to cloud and micro-service-based architectures, drive automation, digitise colleague and client experiences and deliver insight from WPP's petabytes of data.
The successful candidate will work as a business analyst providing help across the functional workstreams on the Financials and PSA project. You will report to the WPP Workday Functional workstream lead.
What you'll be doing:
As a Workday FINS and PSA Business Analyst, you will play a crucial role in understanding business requirements and translating them into effective Workday solutions and processes. You will work closely with stakeholders, project managers, and technical teams to capture key decisions, identify gaps, and document future state processes. Your expertise will be crucial in creating comprehensive fit-gap analyses and ensuring all dependencies and open items are understood and addressed.
Key Responsibilities -
Stakeholder Engagement:
Collaborate with business stakeholders to gather and analyze requirements.
Communicate effectively with cross-functional teams to ensure alignment and understanding of project goals and deliverables.
Workshop Participation:
Attend and actively participate in discovery and design workshops.
Capture and document key decisions, open items, and dependencies discussed during workshops.
Fit-Gap Analysis:
Create detailed fit-gap analyses to compare current state processes with future state requirements in Workday.
Identify areas where existing processes do not align with Workday capabilities and collaborate with business stakeholders to define solutions or alternatives.
Documentation:
Develop and maintain comprehensive documentation of future state processes.
Ensure all documentation is accurate, up-to-date, and accessible to relevant stakeholders.
Dependency and Issue Management:
Track and manage dependencies, risks, and issues related to the Workday implementation.
Proactively identify potential roadblocks and work with project teams to develop mitigation strategies.
What you'll need:
Proven experience as a Business Analyst, preferably in ERP or HRIS transformation projects.
Understanding of financial processes and professional services operations
Ideally, experience in Workday Financials and Professional Services Automation modules
Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate business requirements into actionable system solutions
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills, capable of interacting with diverse teams and influencing decision-making
Excellent documentation skills, with a keen eye for detail.
Experience with fit-gap analysis and process mapping.
Ability to work independently and manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.

Position Title:
Business Analyst-Technology Services-OPA2
Job Description:
Business Analyst-Operations & Policy Analyst 2
The Technology Services Department within the Oregon State Hospital in Salem is seeking a Business Analyst to join our team. The primary purpose of the Business Analyst is to define requirements for new information systems and modifications to existing systems to ensure business needs are met, prepare documents for system acquisition through procurement or development, perform process reengineering to ensure work processes and business requirements are in alignment, and to prepare and execute plans for organizational change management and business transition from current to future states.
This position is elegible for telecommuting.

What you will do!
This position will participate as part of a team in the decision making regarding complex information system design, acquisition, and implementation. This position will make decisions in conjunction with other TSM Staff, project sponsors, end-users, and information system staff required to acquire and implement information systems. These decisions will lead to the successful or unsuccessful implementation of systems and process changes that will primarily span multiple OSH campuses across the state and may secondarily affect systems and processes in other agencies or divisions such as Addictions and Mental Health, Office of Information Systems, or the Department of Administrative Services. The effect of decisions or the lack thereof will impact patients and staff at OSH. These effects may include, but are not limited to, enhanced treatment, safety and care of patients, increased or decreased recidivism, operational efficiencies,
Work in conjunction with stakeholders, project team, information system staff, and other agencies to analyze, plan, and document for system acquisition activities such as:
Project initiation documents including project summaries, business cases, project charters, options analyses, and impact analyses, etc.
Procurement documents including Requests for Information, Requests for Proposal, statements of work, etc.
Design and development documents including functional requirements, mock-ups, specifications, use cases, traceability matrices, etc.
Work in conjunction with stakeholders, project team, information system staff, and other agencies to analyze, plan, and document system implementation activities such as:
Implementation plans
Communication plans
Data conversion plans
Testing plans
Maintenance and support plans
Work in conjunction with stakeholders, project team, information system staff, and other agencies to analyze, plan, and document business process re-engineering activities such as:
Business process maps
Business transition plans
Normal work hours are Monday through Friday 8:00am to 5:00pm. Extended hours may be required in the evenings or on weekends as the department is subject to fluctuating workloads and priorities. Extensive use of the computer telephone, and fax machines. Occasional contact with patients with mental illness, other agency representatives, and members of the public. Incidental local and in-state travel is required.
What's in it for you?
A position where your input and contributions impact Oregonians
11 paid holidays per year
8hours of vacation leave and 8 hours of sick leave per month, and many other paid leave days
Nearly unbeatable
medical, vision, and dental benefits
Pension and retirement programs
Employee Assistance Plan
Flexible Spending accounts
This posting will be used to fill one Permanent, full-time position. This position is represented by a union, SEIU.

OHA values health equity, service excellence, integrity, leadership, partnership, innovation and transparency. OHA’s health equity definition is “Oregon will have established a health system that creates health equity when all people can reach their full potential and well-being and are not disadvantaged by their race, ethnicity, language, disability, age, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, social class, intersections among these communities or identities, or other socially determined circumstances. Achieving health equity requires the ongoing collaboration of all regions and sectors of the state, including tribal governments to address: the equitable distribution or redistributing of resources and power; and recognizing, reconciling, and rectifying historical and contemporary injustices.” OHA’s 10-year goal is to eliminate health inequities. Click
here
, to learn more about OHA’s mission, vision and core values.
WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR:

A Bachelor's Degree in Business or Public Administration, Behavioral or Social Sciences, Finance, Political Science, Information Technology or any degree demonstrating the capacity for the knowledge and skills; and two years professional-level evaluative, analytical and planning work in a technical environment.
OR;
Any combination of experience and education equivalent to five years of experience that typically supports the knowledge and skills for the classification

Identifying and documenting business processes

Theory, principles, and practices of organizational change management

Any criminal or founded abuse history will be reviewed and could result in the withdrawal of the offer or termination of employment.

title: Business Analyst

description:
Performs full spectrum of financial planning, analysis, budgeting and accounting assignments including preparation, monitoring and reporting of business unit financial plans and providing support in analyzing financial impact of major business and regulatory issues. Provides support to business unit operating departments and regions in financial consulting, process costing, process improvement, new product/service development planning, and performance measurement support and analysis.

Prepares analysis and reports of financial and operational data to assist company and business unit management achieve performance targets.
Coordinates and prepares annual O&M and capital budgets and related cash flows.
Coordinates with other business units and prepares financial and cost allocation plans and monthly/quarterly performance reviews.
Supports the development of business unit strategic plans.
Provides support in the development of computerized solutions to meet such requirements.
Provides support in the tracking and analysis of operational and financial performance measures and indicators for the business unit segment.
Performs special projects and studies as assigned by manager. Performs business unit cost planning and analysis and develops and coordinates the resource allocation process at the business unit including modifying and/or improving the process as business needs change.
Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance or Business Administration and a minimum of 5 years relevant experience or equivalent training and/or experience. CPA, CMA, MBA and/or other professional certifications/advanced degree is preferred.

Expert knowledge of all standard office software (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, and Outlook).

Possesses a thorough understanding of the “big picture” and ability to interpret accounting, regulatory, and financial theories and concepts, and develop alternative solutions to the Company’s current businesses and regulatory issues to enhance shareholder value.

Good knowledge of generally accepted accounting and costing principles and methodologies.

Must have a thorough understanding of accounting and costing principles and methodologies. Preferred knowledge of SAP/BW. Preferred knowledge of CMS, NBMS, DART and DataMart.

title: Business Analyst

benefits: AD&D insurance,Dental insurance,Dependent health insurance coverage,Disability insurance,Flexible spending account,Health insurance,Health savings account
description:
Summary
Under the general direction of the Chief Technology Officer, the Business Analyst will support significant software technology development programs for CSBA and its members. This position will contribute to the development of technical solutions to business needs by defining, analyzing, prioritizing, and documenting business requirements, while clearly communicating recommendations and outcomes to leadership, vendors, and staff. This position researches and analyzes issues as it relates to program subject matter with a complex understanding of data analysis, software development and lifecycles, business analysis, requirements management, and strategic planning for the organization. This position will organize, guide and direct the activities of the cross-functional project teams and prioritize tasks to meet deliverables and commitments on time; perform a variety of other duties as assigned.
This position is in a hybrid work environment based out of West Sacramento. This is a full-time limited-term position for a three-year term offering full benefits.
Essential Duties & Responsibilities
Systematically elicit, document, and prioritize stakeholder business needs to inform technology solutions, process improvement, or data-driven insights.
Dissect complex problems, identify pain points, and translate into actionable specifications.
Lead interviews, workshops, surveys, and research to ensure a comprehensive understanding of business needs.
Utilize analytical tools and techniques to interpret complex datasets to uncover patterns, trends, and opportunities.
Create reports, dashboards, and visualizations to communicate findings effectively.
Recommend informed decisions that drive efficiency, cost savings, and growth.
Map and evaluate existing business processes to identify inefficiencies, bottlenecks, redundancies, and areas for optimization.
Develop strategies and solutions to streamline workflows, enhance operational efficiency, and drive continuous improvement initiatives.
Measurably demonstrate increases in operational efficiency and productivity resulting from implemented improvements.
Build mutual trust through active engagement between Information Technology and its stakeholders.
Model clear, consistent, and effective communication to ensure alignment on common goals, requirements, and deliverables.
Enhance department reputation with stakeholders through demonstrated value.
Zealous advocate for stakeholder needs.
Work closely with cross-functional teams to design and document solutions to address business requirements.
Create functional specifications, user stories, and system workflows to guide the development and implementation process.
Own success of the solutions and a continuous improvement cycle to evolve them further.
Partner with project management resources to implement project processes (scoping, planning, implementation, post-launch support, resource allocation, constraint management).
Contribute to timely delivery of successful project outcomes within project constraints.
Monitor project progress, identify risks, proactively address issues to mitigate potential delays or setbacks.
Guide teams through transitions, adopting new technology, process changes, or organizational shifts.
Facilitate thorough testing and validation of solutions to ensure they meet business requirements and quality standards.
Collaborate with testing teams to develop test cases, execute test procedures, and validate outcomes.
Uphold and model CSBA’s vision, mission, values, policies, and practices.
Contribute to association and departmental strategic plans and objectives by developing and applying subject matter expertise in assigned areas.
Participate in the short- and long-term strategy and direction for the association and the department.
Monitor changes in regulations, legislative issues, education policy trends, and innovations.
Maintains current understanding of education industry, from state and federal laws to local district politics.
Demonstrate respect, honesty and professionalism at all times.
Perform a variety of other duties as assigned.

Qualifications
Knowledge of:
Principles and best practices of large-scale technology-based business analysis, requirements management, and stakeholder engagement.
Principles and best practices of software development lifecycle methodologies, including Agile and Waterfall.
Software tools supporting large-scale software development initiatives including project schedules, project status, DevOps, and requirements management.
Research, analytical and statistical experience, including both qualitative and quantitative analysis.
Administrative principles and practices, including goal setting, program development, implementation, and evaluation.
School Board, School District, and County Board organization and work.
California’s Education System and overall Education Policy knowledge.
Federal, state, and local government organizations, research methods and techniques, including planning of studies and investigations, statistical procedures, general principles, concepts and terminology used in research.
Ability to:
Work independently and collaboratively in a hybrid environment.
Elicit, analyze, and synthesize complex ideas and concepts into structured specifications of business needs.
Ruthlessly manage scope and priority, capturing all ideas but ensuring the most critical are addressed first.
Successfully and creatively address conflict, keeping all parties engaged and invested in the outcome.
Facilitate and engage large teams consisting of various types of roles and skill sets.
Plan, coordinate, and facilitate effective meetings and stakeholder engagement, encouraging open discussion and mutual understanding.
Effectively capture business needs and objections in functional and non-functional business requirements for a system and/or process/workflow.
Represent the voice of the customer in a technology solution, demanding quality business outcomes and ensuring mutual success.
Communicate and document project statuses and key decisions to key stakeholders.
Research, analyze, and write reports.
Maintain high standards with regard to content and form of written work.
Work both independently and in collaboration with colleagues to meet individual and team goals.
Balance multiple work responsibilities, tasks, projects while keeping to appropriate timelines.
Maintain confidentiality.
Education & Experience
Any combination of training and experience equivalent to a bachelor’s degree or higher with major coursework in education leadership, business administration, computer science or related field or equivalent education and/or experience and three (3) to five (5) years of experience in business analysis, information technology, education policy research and analysis, and project management.
Environment Elements & Physical Demands
Employee works in a primarily sedentary office environment with moderate noise levels, controlled temperature conditions, and no direct exposure to hazardous physical substances.
Employee is personally responsible for following health and safety guidelines, instructions, and policies.
Must possess mobility to work in a standard office setting and use standard office equipment, including a computer; vision to read printed materials and computer screen, and hearing and speech to communicate in person, and over the telephone; must be able to bend, stoop, kneel, reach, push and pull drawers open and closed in the execution of duties.
Must be able to sit at computer for long periods of time and have the dexterity to access, enter, and retrieve data using a computer keyboard or calculator, and operate standard office equipment.
Employee must possess the ability to lift, carry, push, and pull materials and objects weighing up to 25 pounds, hand truck available to assist.
Must be able to travel overnight on occasion throughout the state of California.
Must have the dexterity and mobility to facilitate or present information to a group, access, enter, and retrieve data using a computer keyboard or calculator, and operate standard facilitation equipment.
Hybrid work environment based out of CSBA’s headquarters.

description:
You could be the one who changes everything for our 28 million members. Centene is transforming the health of our communities, one person at a time. As a diversified, national organization, you’ll have access to competitive benefits including a fresh perspective on workplace flexibility.
**Join the Provider Data Management Team with Louisiana Healthcare Connections** This role is Monday- Friday 8-5pm CST.
Position Purpose: With the Louisiana Healthcare Connections PDM team, you will perform various analysis and interpretation to link business needs and objectives for assigned function.
Gather and interpret business requirements and monitor data trends to proactively identify issues using your Power Bi experience.
The Provider Data Management team supports business initiatives through data analysis, identification of implementation barriers and user acceptance testing of various systems.
Maintain and modify SQL scripts based on business requirements.
Present and facilitate meetings with Executive leadership.
Support execution of large-scale projects with limited direction from leadership
Identify and analyze user requirements, procedures, and problems to improve existing processes
Serve as the subject matter expert on the assigned function product to ensure operational performance
Perform detailed analysis on multiple projects, recommend potential business solutions and ensure successful implementations
Diagnose problems and identify opportunities for process redesign and improvement
Formulate and update departmental policies and procedures
Train staff on Centene preferred applications.
REQUIRED Education/Experience:
Provider Data: Bachelor’s degree in related field or equivalent experience. 4+ years of business process analysis (documenting business process, gathering requirements) experience in healthcare industry and/or working in a data driven environment. Knowledge of data migration, software enhancement/planning, and Agile preferred. Experience managing projects with a high reliance on technology.

Power Bi (Mid Level)
SQL (mid Level)
Cenprov
Portico
Microsoft Excel (Mid to High level)
Working knowledge of Jira

description:
If you are looking for a challenging and exciting career in the world of technology, then look no further. Skyworks is an innovator of high-performance analog semiconductors whose solutions are powering the wireless networking revolution. Through our broad technology expertise and one of the most extensive product portfolios in the industry, we are Connecting Everyone and Everything, All the Time.

At Skyworks, you will find a fast-paced environment with a strong focus on global collaboration, minimal layers of management, and the freedom to make meaningful contributions in a setting that encourages creative thinking. We value open communication, mutual trust, and respect. We are excited about the opportunity to work with you and glad you want to be part of a team of talented individuals who together are changing the way the world communicates.
Requisition ID: 74078
Description
This Sr. Business Analyst role at Skyworks Solutions is a pivotal position that requires a dynamic individual with a strong background in the semiconductor industry. This role is responsible for spearheading initiatives to enhance cost efficiency, bolster gross margins, and support market share expansion in the mobile market business segment.
This role reports directly to the Director of Product Line Management for the Mobile Solutions Business unit and can be located in our Newbury Park or Irvine, CA location.
In this role, you will work synergistically with the IT and data science departments. to forge advanced online analytical tools to process and interpret vast data sets, discern trends, and formulate actionable strategies. These strategies will be instrumental in guiding the design engineering and manufacturing teams resulting in refined product costs and increased gross margin. The successful candidate will influence cross-functional teams, including, but not limited to finance, sourcing, marketing, program management, design engineering, and manufacturing, to realize the company's objectives.
Key Responsibilities:
Collaboration: Partner with Skyworks' IT department and data science teams to enhance Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) tools, ensuring high data integrity standards and streamlined analysis and reporting processes
Data Management: Define and drive the implementation of robust methods for collecting, processing, and analyzing large datasets to extract meaningful insights through collaboration with IT
BOM Review: Ensure accuracy and consistency across various systems such as SAP, Agile, Hyperion, and others by reviewing and updating the Bill of Materials (BOM) for new products
Cost Optimization: Utilize data automation techniques to analyze product cost trends to identify and implement cost-saving measures to improve gross margin.
Communication: Effectively present data findings and strategic insights to stakeholders clearly and concisely
Predictive Analytics: Define and oversee the implementation of statistical and machine learning models to uncover patterns, trends, and predictions within data sets by collaborating with the data science team and data engineering from IT
Model Management: Regularly assess the performance of analytical models, optimizing and recalibrating as needed to maintain accuracy and relevance
Required Experience and Skills
Bachelor's or master's degree in electrical engineering, computer science, statistics, mathematics, business or a related field
8 or more years of relevant experience
Knowledge and/or proficiency in P&L management
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and leadership skills
Strong communication, collaboration, and presentation skills
Familiarity with semiconductor manufacturing processes and technologies
Preferred Experience and Skills
Experience with data analysis and modeling tools such as Microsoft SQL
MBA or Finance background
Excel programming experience
#LI-MT1

The typical base pay range for this role across the U.S. is currently USD $110,600 - $210,600 per year. Starting base pay will depend on relevant experience and skills, training and education, business needs, market demands, the ultimate job duties and requirements, and work location. Skyworks has different base pay ranges for different work locations in the U.S. Benefits include access to healthcare benefits (including a premium-free medical plan option), a 401(k) plan and company match, an employee stock purchase plan, paid time off (including vacation, sick/wellness, parental leave), among others. Employees are eligible to participate in an incentive plan, and certain roles are also eligible for additional awards, including recognition and stock. These incentives and awards are based on individual and/or company performance.

Skyworks is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Skyworks strives to create an accessible workplace; if you need an accommodation due to a disability, please contact us at accommodations@skyworksinc.com.

description:
Senior Technical Business Analyst

Job Description

CoStar Group (NASDAQ: CSGP) is a leading global provider of commercial and residential real estate information, analytics, and online marketplaces. Included in the S&P 500 Index and the NASDAQ 100, CoStar Group is on a mission to digitize the world’s real estate, empowering all people to discover properties, insights and connections that improve their businesses and lives.
The Analytics team is responsible for the development of CoStar's customer-facing Real Estate Analytics products. We think big, creating innovative data-intensive applications that take the vast amount of data collected by our CoStar Research teams to create a fast, reliable and intuitive analytics platform for our customers. We are a collaborative group with a mix of big data, API/platform and front-end skills, and we are growing rapidly to help invent the future of Real Estate Analytics.
Our San Diego team is seeking an accomplished Senior Technical Business Analyst to join our team in supporting multiple software products and brands across the organization, such as www.costar.com. You will have a direct impact on highly visible web applications that touch millions of users. You will continuously learn emerging technologies and architecture advancements and apply these tools to improve our software products.
This position is located in San Diego (UTC Area) and offers a schedule of 3 days onsite, 2 days remote.
Responsibilities
Understanding the CoStar business, the goals of our products, and collaborating with Product Development and Design in the creation of those products
Writing acceptance criteria for user stories that contain key information for the development team to do their work
Maintain direct channels of communication with software developers, management, and Product Design to accomplish team goals
Responding to analytic specific issues that are raised by internal and external groups
Identifying and document business trends utilizing real data that will support new features and applications
Holding regular stakeholder/grooming meetings to keep all interested parties updated in project progress
Documenting user requirements and business rules to be used in application development
Understanding End-To-End test cases at the application and multi-application levels
Working directly with QA Staff to ensure comprehensive testing for all areas and provide input as to how to test new features
Basic Qualifications
Bachelor’s Degree required from an accredited, not for profit university or college
A track record of commitment to prior employers
Minimum of 5+ years of Product, Systems, or Business analysis experience
2+ years of Product Owner experience is a plus
This role is highly self-directed and requires driving outcomes with very little supervision.
Documenting detailed product requirements for multiple development teams
Documenting requirements for API work a plus
Occasionally, creating flow diagrams in a tool such as Visio is required for this role.
Agile/Scrum experience is required
Preferred Qualifications And Skills
Basic SQL database knowledge
Advanced Excel knowledge
Experience with Agile Development process
Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities
What’s in it for You
When you join CoStar Group, you’ll experience a collaborative and innovative culture working alongside the best and brightest to empower our people and customers to succeed.
We offer you generous compensation and performance-based incentives. CoStar Group also invests in your professional and academic growth with internal training, tuition reimbursement, and an inter-office exchange program.
Our benefits package includes (but is not limited to):
Comprehensive healthcare coverage: Medical / Vision / Dental / Prescription Drug
Life, legal, and supplementary insurance
Virtual and in person mental health counseling services for individuals and family
Commuter and parking benefits
401(K) retirement plan with matching contributions
Employee stock purchase plan
Paid time off
Tuition reimbursement
On-site fitness center and/or reimbursed fitness center membership costs (location dependent), with yoga studio, Pelotons, personal training, group exercise classes
Access to CoStar Group’s Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion Employee Resource Groups
Complimentary gourmet coffee, tea, hot chocolate, fresh fruit, and other healthy snacks
We welcome all qualified candidates who are currently eligible to work full-time in the United States to apply. However, please note that CoStar Group is not able to provide visa sponsorship for this position.
This position offers a base salary range of $100,000 - $178,000, based on relevant skills and experience and includes a generous benefits plan.
#LI-IZ1

CoStar Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer; we maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing

description:
Company Overview

Every firm has a culture – the values, beliefs, methodology, attitudes and standards that reflect an organization’s DNA. But the truly inspiring firms – the game-changers, the industry leaders and the disruptors – have cultures that propel them to innovate and stand out. At Brown Advisory, we aim to be one of those inspired firms. Over the years, we have purposefully built and nurtured our client-first culture.
Brown Advisory is an independent investment management and strategic advisory firm committed to delivering a combination of first-class performance, strategic advice and the highest level of client service with offices in Austin, Baltimore, Boston, Delaware, Frankfurt, London, Nashville, New York, North Carolina, San Francisco, Singapore, Southern California, Tokyo, Virginia and Washington, D.C. The firm’s institutional and private clients are based in 50 states and more than 44 countries and territories and are served by over 850 colleagues worldwide, all of whom are equity owners of the firm.
Brown Advisory Technology is currently seeking a mid-level Business Analyst/Project Manager to join our team and engage on critical efforts that are currently underway, or on our immediate project roadmap. This individual will be tasked with bringing mature business analysis discipline and focus to our environment, while also supporting a culture of agility, entrepreneurship and innovation. In addition to gathering and coalescing requirements, this individual will assist in broader project and portfolio management activities. This may include requirements consolidation, vendor engagement through request for information/request for proposal processes, process mapping, field mapping, and other duties as requested.
Duties and Responsibilities
Identify and clearly document business unit requirements.
Analyze firm functions, processes, activities, and systems to improve their performance and/or effectiveness.
Determine the most useful business solutions for the firm.
Recommend alternative solutions to best meet the firm's goals.
Work closely and collaboratively with leadership and key business stakeholders to identify and solve a variety of business problems.
Solicit from stakeholders the symptoms of a problem, formally define the problem, break problem into component parts, and gather information about each of these parts from a variety of sources.
Write a description of business needs, business program functions, and steps required to develop or modify an application/system/process.
Review current capabilities, workflow, scheduling, lifecycle, and other limitations to determine if a program or program change is possible within an existing system (current vs. future state).
Document requirements in such a way that they may be tested in a standard/repeatable fashion.
Perform testing of requirements that have been written/documented, to assist with QA.
Write technical and process documentation and other relevant diagrams and materials.
Clear obstacles, bird-dog tasks and team member accountability, and escalate issues, as required.
Drive broad stakeholder engagement and communications.
Assist with oversight of 3rd party suppliers that are engaged on efforts.
Consult with other team members regarding project management standards and activities.
Coordinate with project teams.
Create project and process specifications.
Job Requirements
3+ years’ experience as a business analyst, supporting both application development, infrastructure, and/or security technology initiatives.
Must have an understanding of and experience with project management methodologies, including iterative development, Agile/Scrum, and structured approaches.
Must have strong knowledge and experience with MS Project or other project management software (Jira, Confluence, Atlassian Suite, GitHub, Redmine, Version One, Yodiz, SmartSheet, Teams, etc.)
Experience establishing, documenting and maintaining process information.
Experience in financial services and regulated environments is preferred.
Gain a good understanding of the organization’s business goals and objectives.

title: Business Analyst

description:
SUMMARY
The primary responsibilities of the Business Analyst are to oversee business and data analytics for the company. The BA manages the processes responsible for accurate data collection, processing, modeling, and analysis to convert insights into tools for strategic decision making and opportunities. Responsibilities include execution of business/data analytics activities and processes to enhance overall management information and business growth.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Ensure accuracy of data and consistent reporting across all functions.
Assist and/or lead cross-functional projects using data modeling and analysis to reveal insights for decision making and strategic direction.
Oversee design and delivery of reports and insights that analyze business functions, key operations and performance metrics.
Oversee generation of data insight initiatives through effective management of data analytics.
Ensure the continued education of the team members to function as the onsite knowledge base for the businesses ERP/MRP/DRP systems.
Ensure team is trained to expertise on all data/IT systems utilized by the company, to include, but not limited to VIP, Vertique, etc.
Collaborate with IT in evaluating, testing and rollout of new functionality and/or new systems to satisfy the businesses data needs.
Provide support to training department to ensure appropriate personnel are trained to proficiency in the use of data/IT tools.
Conduct in-person training as requested.
Assist in development of online training as requested.
Understand short and long-term business strategy and goals to develop and offer recommendations on how to best utilize data analytics to support the mission.
Oversee use of data analysis to help solve problems, opportunities and provide solutions for improvement across multiple projects and functions.
Utilize analytics to contribute to the companys growth and success.
Design Reports needed to track achievement of goals and incentives in our software system.
Design surveys to support sales initiatives in the market.
Assist managers with the development of monthly/quarterly business reviews and presentation to chains, key accounts, special accounts and etc.
Oversee set up new account files and validate proper permitting on ABC website.
Will be in-house expert on systems, such as VIP.
COMPETENCIES REQUIRED
Analytical Synthesizes complex or diverse information; uses intuition and experience to complement data using dashboards, pivot tables, and data slicer.
Problem Solving Identifies and resolves problems in a timely manner; develops alternative solutions; uses reason even when dealing with emotional topics.
Technical Skills Strives to continuously build knowledge and skills; Shares expertise with others.
Interpersonal Listens to others without interrupting; remains open to others ideas and tries new things
Oral Communication Speaks clearly and persuasively in positive or negative situations; responds well to questions; participates actively in all company meetings.
Teamwork Puts success of team above own interests; able to build morale and group commitments to goals and objectives; recognizes accomplishments of other team members.
Change Management communicates changes effectively; monitors transition and evaluates results.
Leadership Exhibits confidence in self and others; inspires and motivates others to perform well; accepts feedback from others.
Business Acumen Understands business implications of decisions; demonstrates knowledge of market and competition; aligns work with strategic goals.
Cost Consciousness Works within approved budget; contributes to profits and revenue.
Organizational Support Follows policies and procedures; supports organizations goals and values; benefits organization through outside activities.
Judgement Displays willingness to make decisions; supports and explains reasoning for decisions.
Motivation Sets and achieves challenging goals; measures self against standard of excellence.
Professionalism Treats others with respect and consideration regardless of their status or position.
Safety and Security Observes safety and security procedures.
QUALIFICATIONS
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
JOB KNOWLEDGE and EXPERIENCE
Knowledge of a specialized field such as cost or general accounting, statistical programming, database management, etc. Equivalent to a high school education plus additional broad specialized training equal to two years of technical or other college. Over one year up to and including 3 years.
COMPLEXITY OF DUTIES
Diversified duties involving an intensive knowledge of a restricted field, and the use of a wide range of procedures. Requires the use of judgment in the analysis of facts and circumstances surrounding individual problems or transactions and in the determination of action to be taken within the limits of standard or accepted practice.
SUPERVISION RECEIVED
Under general supervision, where standard practice enables the employee to proceed alone with regular duties, referring questionable cases to supervisor or others.
RESPONSIBILITY FOR ERRORS
Probable errors usually detected in succeeding operations and generally confined to a single department or phase of company activities. Most of work verified or checked. Corrections may involve backchecking by others or some minor monetary losses.
CONTACT WITH OTHERS
Contacts with other persons within the department on routine matters or occasional contacts with other departments or outside the company, furnishing or obtaining information requiring only ordinary courtesy and tact.
CONFIDENTIAL DATA
Work with some confidential data of major importance such as development projects, profit margins, business planning which, if disclosed, may be detrimental to the companys interests.
MENTAL / VISUAL / AUDITORY DEMAND
Moderately exacting work, requiring mental and visual attention in such typical tasks as statistical computations, correspondence, tabulations, etc.
WORK ENVIRONMENT
The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Usual office working conditions.
EQUIPMENT
Also, ability to operate standard office machines such as copier, computer, fax, calculator, etc. Intermediate skills with Excel, Word, and other Microsoft office application programs.
LANGUAGE SKILLS
Ability to read, analyze, and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, technical procedures, or governmental regulations. Ability to write reports, business correspondence, and procedure manuals. Ability to respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, customers, and the general public.
MATHEMATICAL SKILLS
Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals. Ability to compute rate, ratio, and percent and to draw and interpret bar graphs.
PHYSICAL DEMANDS
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; and talk or hear. The employee is occasionally required to stand, walk, and reach with hands and arms. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, and ability to adjust focus.
A job description, by its nature, can't include every aspect of the job. Because of this, any function that would reasonably fall under the responsibility of the Business Analyst is assumed and it is expected that the Business Analyst will act accordingly. The Business Analyst will be expected to perform any other task not included in this job description requested by management.
title: Business Analyst

description:
Position Description

The Lead Business Analyst will work with the Project Manager and Client Business Owner to define the scope of a project / release, as well as develop user stories and functional requirement documents to describe the application requirements to support the project scope.

Additional responsibilities include:
Leading the interaction with various business stakeholders to gather, organize, and evaluate business requirements
Documenting and reviewing the business requirements with various business and technology stakeholders
Converting meeting minutes, business requirements, and other source material into User Stories
Assisting the architect and develop team to develop the high-level design
Preparing various deliverables and other document artifacts
Provide guidance and oversight to a small development team

The projected compensation range for this position is $110K-135K (annualized USD). The final salary offered will generally fall within this range and is determined by various factors, including but not limited to the individual’s particular combination of education, knowledge, skills, competencies, and experience, as well as internal pay equity, location, contract-specific affordability and other organizational requirements.

Required Skills
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Business Administration, or related field
At least 6 years of experience working as a business or systems analyst in gathering, analyzing, and documenting functional requirements
Experience in modernizing legacy applications to Cloud Platform
Experience translating high level business requirements into user stories
Experience using Agile management tools such as Azure DevOps, GitHub
Strong oral and written communication skills and a proficiency in the Microsoft Office suite
Good technical / creative writing skills
Experience in taking comprehensive notes in meetings, even if the subject matter is unfamiliar
Must be a US Citizen

Desirable Skills
Federal Government Consulting experience
Experience working on web application development projects
Experience working with Microsoft technologies (SharePoint, Dynamics, Power Platform)
Experience in Microsoft Visio and Project
