description:
McCrometer (www.mccrometer.com) is a global leader in flow instrumentation. As we design, develop, and manufacture world-class flow measurement equipment, our impact is far-reaching: Our products are used in the oil and gas industry, agriculture and irrigation, water and wastewater systems management, and industrial processes.
Behind the innovations McCrometer works on every day is an amazing team with deep expertise in flow physics and real-world operating dynamics who put McCrometer at the forefront of flow technologies. Joining us means the opportunity to work hands-on in the field, and to apply your passion and extensive knowledge to helping customers around the world.
Motivated by the highest possible stakes of climate change and global health, we’re working together within a rapidly digitizing industry to find innovative technologies that guarantee the safety of our water and our environment.
McCrometer is proud to be a Water Quality company in Veralto (NYSE: VLTO). Imagine a world where everyone has access to clean water, safe food and medicine, and trusted essential goods. That is the tomorrow Veralto is creating today. Veralto is a $5B global leader in essential technology solutions made up of over 16,000 associates across our Water Quality and Product Identification segments all united by a powerful purpose: Safeguarding the World’s Most Vital Resources.
About the role:
The CRM Business Analyst is responsible for developing enhancing efforts for our global CRM system (Salesforce.com), supporting and leading the implementation of new features and functionalities on our Salesforce platform, manage internal requests for improvements and solve customer problems by providing a strong customer focus, applying analytical skills and being solution oriented. This position will help to implement required improvements in the system, customize and modify the system to meet our company needs and support our business processes.
This position is part of the Sales Organization located in Hemet, CA and will be remote.
In this role, you will:
Define project scope and document business requirements
Design technical specifications, leveraging best practices and minimizing the need for custom coding
Provide internal CRM consulting, analyze data and processes to improve the business process to driving growth
Configure and customize our Salesforce platform to meet the internal customer requirements
Automate processes using Salesforce automation tools, such as Flows; develop solutions to integrate with Oracle
Support the global roll-out of the SFDC CPQ system
Implement ServiceMax and a software vendor specializing in data visualization, executive dashboards and self-service business intelligence products
Create test scenarios and do solution testing
Functional and technical CRM support as well as troubleshooting of (integration) issues
Support the set up of integrations to existing business systems
Provide project management and project documentation to ensure that the organization stays within compliance guidelines
Are you qualified?
BA or BS degree in a technically related field or equivalent technical work experience
3+ years proven experience designing and developing effective and efficient technology solutions using Salesforce CRM application
Experience in SFDC CPQ implementation
Experience as Salesforce administrator, consultant or developer with strong knowledge of administration and configuration possibilities
Experience with PowerBI, Tableau, and/or Qlik a plus
Salesforce Development (APEX, Visualforce, Lightning Web Components, etc.) experience a plus
Salesforce certification(s) a plus
Successful project management experience
Proven effectiveness in working with other associates in a global cross-functional team
Capability to analyze and evaluate complex business processes
High degree of independence and self-initiative
Good time management and working structure
Occasional willingness to travel (<10%)
US ONLY:
The below range reflects the range of possible compensation for this role at the time of this posting. We may ultimately pay more or less than the posted range. This range may be modified in the future. An associate’s position within the salary range will be based on several factors, including, but not limited to, relevant education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, seniority, geographic location, performance, shift, travel requirements, sales or revenue-based metrics, any collective bargaining agreements, and business or organizational needs.
The compensation range for this role is $115,000 - $140,000 USD per year.
We offer a comprehensive package of benefits including paid time off, medical/dental/vision insurance and 401(k) to eligible employees.

title: Business Analyst

description:
The Associate Business Analyst administers software solutions for ORA's functional areas (SOARFIN and InfoEd) as well as assisting with any computer issues users have. The ABA runs internal processes in USM's financial system, establishes new awards in the financial system, including determination of contract components for billing, revenue, and accounts receivable. Reviews software solutions for updates and tests/implements changes to environments.

Primary Duties and Responsibilities
Manages setup of new sponsored project awards in USM's complex financial system, including determination of appropriate billing, revenue, and accounts receivable plans. Notifies project directors of their project accounts, responds to questions, and provides resolution or referral. Performs all financial system processes related to project management including but not limited to billing, revenue, and F&A.
Participates in software implementations, testing, and maintenance for ORA's functional areas. Includes creation of business process and scripts, user training, and problem solving. Evaluates and recommends technology solutions. Manages work orders for ORA technology and identifies and resolves problems with hardware and software.
Provides standard and ad hoc reports for Deans, Directors, VPs, IHL and others related to ORA proposals, awards, and expenditures. Creates new data queries as required, and interacts with iTech on complex reporting requiring SQR programming.
Reviews high-risk expenditure categories on externally funded projects for compliance with federal, state, and university standards. Interacts with other ORA staff, project directors, academic deans and directors to resolve expenditures that are not compliant. Identifies and recommends methods to strengthen internal controls and implements approved solutions.
Communicates with faculty, staff, directors, deans, and others to answer questions, resolve problems, and improve process and procedure.
Stays abreast of regulations affecting research administration.
Performs other duties as assigned.
Minimum Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university in Business, Information or Systems Technology, or related field –OR- an Associate’s Degree/two years of college in Business, Information or Systems Technology or a related field and two years of related work experience.

Knowledge, Skills & Abilities
Experience with meticulous data entry and analysis in complex systems.
Experience with the Microsoft Office Suite, with skill in creating spreadsheets.
Strong communication skills, both verbal and written, including ability to communicate technical information to university clients and ORA staff.
Ability to complete assignments accurately, by the deadline, and with attention to detail.
Ability to learn and explain policies and regulations.
Preferred Qualifications
Master’s degree from an accredited college or university in Business, Information or Systems Technology, or related field. Experience with Oracle products, SQL Developer, and InfoEd products.
About The University of Southern Mississippi
Since our founding in 1910, The University of Southern Mississippi has remained dedicated to preparing students for success. We deliver programs to more than 13,000 students in Hattiesburg and Long Beach, at teaching and research sites across the Mississippi Gulf Coast, as well as online. We are a community-engaged Carnegie R1 university, earning distinction as one of the nation's leading research institutions.

Southern Miss is known for pioneering work in polymer science, ocean science, spectator sports safety and security, and bringing language to children with communication disorders. We are also a national leader in a broad range of disciplines, including cybersecurity, hydrography, nutrition, aquaculture, kinesiology, and economic development, among others.

We produce graduates ready to enter fields that are leading the way in emerging technologies through programs such as computer engineering, information technology, and ocean engineering. We’re developing the next generation of business leaders, while also responding to critical workforce shortages by producing skilled professionals in education and nursing. With a tradition of excellence in the arts, we are one of only 36 public institutions in the nation accredited in four major areas of the arts. Home to the Golden Eagles, our student-athletes compete in 17 NCAA Division I sports. With a culture marked by passion and persistence, Southern Miss is delivering graduates who are ready for life. For more information, visit www.usm.edu.
As an Affirmative Action/Equal Employment Opportunity employer/Americans with Disabilities Act institution, The University of Southern Mississippi encourages minorities, women, veterans and persons with disabilities to apply.

job_title: Business Analyst, Amazon Kids+ Child Engagement
description:
5+ years of Excel or Tableau (data manipulation, macros, charts and pivot tables) experience
3+ years of tax, finance or a related analytical field experience
3+ years of business analyst, data analyst or similar role experience
Bachelor's degree or equivalent
Experience with SQL
Experience defining requirements and using data and metrics to draw business insights
Fundamental understanding of data structures and concepts
Come join Amazon Kids+, the leading streaming service for kids. We offer thousands of popular and age-appropriate games, movies, shows, books, Alexa Skills and more. To learn more, visit http://www.amazon.com/kids

This role will focus on improving kid experiences including content, browsing and recommendations.
You will analyze engagement data to provide key insights to inform leadership on business decisions. This will include querying Amazon's vast data sources to analyze content usage, A/B tests and engagement behaviors. You will develop new KPI's, performance modeling and automated reports. You will own the definition, wireframes and development of building dashboards to provide accessibility of key business metrics across teams. You will inform business goals and provide status on our progress. You will become an expert in kids digital media, industry and customer trends, content performance and more. This is a multi-faceted job in a start-up like environment that requires flexibility, agility, creativity and a sense of humor.

Key job responsibilities
Leverage expertise in SQL and visualization tools to build scalable self-service data solutions to inform business decisions related to content performance, content marketing and child engagement.
Analyze trends within customer segmentation and establish benchmarks and goals.
Drive product and roadmap decisions using data and research to inform priorities.
Dive deep into Amazon's vast data warehouse to investigate issues and use written communication skills to present areas of opportunity to influence content and product roadmaps
Design and execute analytic projects in collaboration with Product, Software Engineering, Finance, and a central Business Intelligence team
Work with technical and non-technical stakeholders to understand and improve product capabilities.
Write concise weekly status updates and other documents to communicate results and insights to stakeholders and senior leadership.
A day in the life
A typical day will start with a team meeting to prioritize a backlog of reporting and analytic needs. You will work with product management stakeholders to translate issues or questions into analytical requirements. You will estimate timing for the request then work independently to identify the correct data sources. You will write SQL queries to transform and aggregate raw data into KPI and summarize your interpretation of the results using your written communication skills. Finally, you will present findings to your stakeholders, leadership and peers.

Experience in financial/business analysis

title: Business Analyst

description:
At Moss Adams, we champion authenticity. For us, that means fostering a culture of talented people who care—about you, about our clients, and about our communities. Here, you’ll work towards our mission of empowering others to embrace opportunity, growing as a leader along the way. Our firm’s size, middle-market clients, customized career paths, and supportive culture make this a reality. Join a values-driven firm where you’ll have fun while solving complex and interesting business challenges.
Introduction to the team
The Senior Business Analyst brings strong analytical expertise to projects to elicit business needs from the customer in order to help determine solutions to complex business problems. They are responsible for the development and management of business and technical requirements. They will assist with product assessments, testing, training, and communication. The senior business analyst acts as a liaison between IT and various teams across the firm.
Individuals who thrive at Moss Adams exhibit the following success skills – Collaboration, Critical Thinking, Emotional Intelligence, Executive Presence, Growth Mindset, Intellectual Curiosity, and Results Focus.

Responsibilities:
Utilize strong analytical and product management skills, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and translate them into business and technical requirements
Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a general understanding
Serve as the conduit between the customer community (including internal and external customers), users, business teams, and technical teams to establish the business and technical vision; analyze and document tradeoffs between complexity, usability and performance needs
Assist with testing by owning the User Acceptance Testing process (UAT) and contributing to the testing phase of a project by supporting the Quality Assurance (QA) team for various testing activities
Assist with training and communication activities such as developing and delivering end user documentation, quick guides, training plans, training materials, and communication media; serve as a liaison between Corporate Communications, Learning and Development, and project teams
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience required
Minimum of 3 years of relevant experience required; experience within IT organizations with exposure to the full system implementation life cycle preferred; experience in a professional services environment preferred
Must be legally authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis upon hire. Moss Adams will not consider candidates for this position who require sponsorship for employment visa status now or in the future (e.g., H-1B status)
Experience leading requirements identification and prioritization efforts for mid-large scale business or technology projects
Demonstrated ability to collect and interpret business data and assess for trends, patterns and correlations
Experience in system design, functional specification development, and test requirement documentation
Experience with developing training plans and conducting training
Proven ability to effectively manage time, prioritize work, multi-task across many assignments, and create deliverables with little direction
Proficiency in Microsoft Office (MS Project, Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and Visio); familiarity with OneNote and SharePoint required; familiarity with a requirement management system preferred
Strong verbal and written communication skills including the ability to articulate complex issues to others at all levels of the organization; the ability to interact professionally with a multi-disciplinary groups
Ability to travel as needed, approximately 5%

Moss Adams is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other characteristic protected by law.

If reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and/or to receive other benefits and privileges of employment, please contact careers@mossadams.com.

job_title: Senior Business Analyst, Prime Video Global Operations
description:
5+ years of experience in program or project management and demonstrated delivery and ownership of program strategy/roadmap in a complex or matrixed environment
5+ years of experience working cross functionally with tech and non-tech teams
Prior background in operational or similar work for business-critical services, including estimating resource requirements, headcount planning, forecasting, defining metrics, and driving improvements to processes
Proven capability in building financial models
Cross-team collaboration skills and effective written and verbal communication skills when interfacing with stakeholders, peers and executives
Experience using data and metrics to drive improvements and influence decision-making
Experience developing, scaling, and governing global operations standards and infrastructure across matrixed organizations
Knowledge of Excel (e.g. Pivot Tables, VLookUps) at an advanced level
Prime Video (PV) brings together the world’s best creators with the most passionate communities in a way that no other entertainment brand can. Not only are we a one-stop hub for distinctive, critically-acclaimed and award-winning original programming including TV series such as The Boys, The Marvelous Mrs. Maisel and Jack Ryan and movies like Air, Saltburn, The Idea of You, and Road House, but we offer a multi-dimensional experience that allows subscribers to fully immerse themselves in their fandom: to read the book, to listen to the soundtrack, to buy the costume, to replay live sports in real time, and more. And that breadth and connection to the Amazon family of brands, along with the support of a passionate and diverse global team, makes Prime Video a company where creators and makers of all kinds can build their future.

We’re looking for a results-driven Senior Business Analyst to join Amazon PV’s Global Operations, Planning & Analysis team. In this role, you will be responsible for taking insights and Voice of Customer input from marketing and business teams, finance, HR, strategy, product, and tech to develop and own insights, planning, and reporting mechanisms for Amazon PV & Amazon MGM Studios.

This individual has proficiency in employing analytical insights, strong business operations fundamentals and high judgment. This individual will also provide thought leadership against future modeling capabilities and programs that enable the acceleration of revenue growth, improved operational efficiencies & delivery. In this role, you will be responsible for using operational, marketing, and human capital data and leveraging tools and expertise to map enterprise strategies into actionable delivery plans. You will influence data driven business decisions that results in quantifiable outcomes, understanding complex business relationships, and developing a correlation between your work and PV’s P&L.

The ideal candidate has a strong sense of ownership, is self-driven and loves to break new ground. You will bring a mix of experience including complex global product management, senior stakeholder engagement, cross-functional collaboration, strategic planning, operational planning, and process improvement. If you enjoy leading global strategic initiatives, working in a fast-paced dynamic environment, and being challenged by new problems, we’d like to speak with you!

Key job responsibilities
Own demand forecasting, prioritization analysis, and resource growth needs for internal PV delivery teams
Be responsible for rhythm of the business reporting and analysis (WBR, MBR, QBR) not only producing reporting but finding ways to generate insights for business stakeholders
Work with business intelligence engineers to produce self-serve automated reporting
Prepare management reporting and monitor performance by collecting, analyzing and summarizing performance data and trends, identifying and resolving problems and developing recommendations
Design and influence operational best practices for reporting and analytics to enable the team to scale as we grow presence in new and existing territories
Help drive new initiatives and data integration projects
Prioritize effectively in a fast-paced environment and highly-matrixed organization
Bachelor's Degree in engineering, industrial & organizational psychology, statistics, mathematics, economics, finance, or related field
Advanced Degree (MS/MBA) in the field of organizational behavior, human resources, analytics, operations or strategy
Experience in large scale workforce, operations, or capacity planning functions
Experience working with data analytics and visualization using tools like SQL, SAS, Tableau, PowerBI, or Quicksight
Experience advocating for the customer and influencing without authority
Experience engaging with and influencing senior executives
Prior experience in media & entertainment or marketing operations

description:
Description
Are you ready for a rewarding career challenge?
Unleash your potential at Leidos, where we deliver innovative solutions through the efforts of our diverse and talented people who are dedicated to our customer’s success. We empower our teams, contribute to our communities, and operate sustainably. Everything we do is built on a commitment to do the right thing for our customers, our people, and our community. Our Mission, Vision, and Values guide the way we do business.
If this sounds like an environment where you can thrive, keep reading!
Do you have what it takes to be part of an elite team driving innovation and transformation within the Air Force Commercial Cloud Services (AFC2S) teams? Join Leidos as a Cloud Business Analyst at Lackland AFB in San Antonio, TX. This is a hybrid position where the candidate is authorized to telework two days a week. If you're a forward-thinking, cloud-savvy professional with a TS/SCI security clearance, we want to hear from you. Your journey to an extraordinary career begins here – apply today!
Your greatest work is ahead!
The Mission
The National Security Sector within Leidos combines technology-enabled services and mission software capabilities for defense and intel customers in the areas of cyber, logistics, security operations, and decision analytics. To explore and learn more, Click here
Are you ready to join a team dedicated to a mission? Begin your journey of a flourishing and meaningful career, share your resume with us today!
Your Main Mission:
Identifying and resolving business issues within Air Force Commercial Cloud Services (AFC2S) teams utilizing services from IC ITE.
Providing onboarding direction for AF customers migrating to the cloud.
Assisting the customer with integrating all cloud solutions and strategies to manage their environment using best business practices and available tools.
Providing guidance on AWS, IC ITE GovCloud, IC ITE Commercial Cloud Services (C2S), and other federal government community or emerging cloud frameworks.
What Sets You Apart (Required Qualifications):
Current / Active TS/SCI security clearance
Bachelor's degree and 5+ years of relevant experience. *(Additional experience may be considered in lieu of degree).
DoD 8570 IAT Level II equivalent certification.
Familiarity with (AWS, Azure, IBM, Oracle, Google) and other cloud services offerings to assist customers with optimizing their environments via cost saving recommendations
One to two (1-2) years of using or administering SharePoint, Jira, Confluence, and other tools to track project and task management.
Assist customers via Help Desk support ticketing system within Jira on any issue associated with onboarding requirements into C2S/C2E.
Research and develop Standard Operating Procedures (SOP) for customer engagement activities.
Facilitate various Customer Engagement Onboarding meetings to include, 101 Program Overview, Tech Onboarding, Tech Fits and other meetings associated with customer onboarding
Be able to assist with budget oversight of cloud customers utilizing tools and applications such as the AWS Billing Console
Ability to gather and evaluate data, reason logically and creatively, draw conclusions, and make appropriate recommendations.
Communicate with all levels of Management, Government officials, peers, and subordinates to ensure clear communications.
A team player capable of high performance and flexibility in a dynamic and collaborative working environment
Good verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to work a hybrid schedule.
You Might Also Have (Desired):
AWS Certified Cloud Practitioner or Solution Architect certification preferred.

job_title: Senior Business Analyst - Requirements Validation Facilitator
benefits: 401(k) matching,Health insurance,Tuition reim
description:
Great companies need great teams to propel their operations. Join the group that solves business challenges and enhances the way we work and grow. Working at Gainwell carries its rewards. You’ll have an incredible opportunity to grow your career in a company that values your contributions and puts a premium on work flexibility, learning, and career development.

Summary
The Senior Business Analyst - Requirements Validation Facilitator is a crucial role responsible for guiding the requirements gathering and validation process for large-scale projects. This position involves managing multiple aspects of requirements, from initial gathering and analysis through client validation and traceability documentation, ensuring all requirements are properly captured, assigned, and refined to meet client expectations. The RV Facilitator also manages the execution of RV sessions, including preparation, scheduling, and post-session documentation. Here are the details on this position.
Your role in our mission
Gainwell empowers you show you’re a pro and help clients deliver better health and human services outcomes using innovative technology and solutions.
1. Gathering Requirements:
Lead the gathering of project requirements, including contract analysis, recomposing and decomposing requirements, and identifying key stakeholders for ownership and RV session participation.
Review artifacts to establish requirement traceability and ensure accurate documentation.
Oversee the loading and management of requirements in the ALM (Application Lifecycle Management) tool.
2. Requirement Assignment:
Assign requirements for RV sessions, ensuring clear ownership and co-ownership.
Support the reassignment of requirement owners as needed, and coordinate the development of an RV schedule.
Manage RV invites, ensuring proper participation and engagement from relevant stakeholders.
3. Refining Requirements:
Assist in the creation of "How Requirement Met" documentation to ensure that all project requirements are client-ready.
Define how the fulfillment of requirements will be verified by the client, coordinating completion of requirement traceability.
Manage any gaps related to requirements and maintain clear, updated documentation via ALM.
Provide clarification and scoping support for requirements when necessary.

....your role continued
4. RV Session Preparation:
Develop the demonstration strategy for RV sessions, ensuring alignment with client expectations.
Create and manage the RV agenda, including eliciting discovery questions and handling client responses.
Coordinate the creation of Business Requirement Documents (BRDs) and schedule/manage dry runs for RV sessions.
Package all RV materials for delivery to the client, ensuring completeness and accuracy.
5. Validation and Maintenance:
Facilitate RV meetings, ensuring discussions remain productive and requirements are validated effectively.
Act as an RV scribe when needed, taking notes and tracking requirement status based on client interactions.
Initiate Change Requests (CR) for canceled or modified requirements and produce the Requirements Traceability Matrix (RTM) to track and validate requirements over the course of the project.
Skills and qualifications
Proven experience in managing and facilitating requirements validation sessions, with a focus on stakeholder engagement and requirement traceability.
Expertise in requirements gathering, decomposition, and stakeholder identification.
Proficient in the use of ALM tools for requirement management, assignment, and traceability documentation.
Strong organizational skills, with the ability to manage schedules, invites, and participant coordination for RV sessions.
Excellent communication and facilitation skills, capable of handling complex discussions and delivering client-ready documentation.
Familiarity with creating Business Requirement Documents and producing detailed reports such as the Requirements Traceability Matrix (RTM).
Ability to manage gaps and initiate Change Requests when needed.
Willingness to travel up to 25% for on-site requirement validation sessions.
What we're looking for
Three or more years of experience translating technical goals and requirements into real action for clients.
Knowledge in the Medicaid program as well as the State / Federal programs preferred
Advanced knowledge in Microsoft Excel and other software for conducting quantitative analysis. SQL queries, reporting data and gap analysis knowledge is a must
Proven experience in managing and facilitating requirements validation sessions and/or client meetings, with a focus on stakeholder engagement.
Expertise in stakeholder identification.
Proficient in the use of ALM tools for requirement management, assignment, and traceability documentation.
Strong organizational skills, with the ability to manage schedules, invites, and participant coordination for RV sessions.
Excellent communication and facilitation skills, capable of handling complex discussions and delivering client-ready documentation.
Familiarity with creating Business Requirement Documents and producing detailed reports such as the Requirements Traceability Matrix (RTM).
Ability to manage gaps and initiate Change Requests when needed.
Strong written and oral communication and presentation skills to deliver messages to business leaders, clients and technical personnel
Capability to work effectively in a deadline-driven environment
Willingness to travel up to 25% for on-site requirement validation sessions.
What you should expect in this role
To be an influencer and team player who that motivates others to action and communicates key business and technical ideas
Fully remote options from most US locations and territories
Video cameras must be used during all interviews, as well as during the initial week of orientation
The deadline to submit applications for this posting is October 1, 2024

title: Business Analyst

description:
At Accenture Federal Services, nothing matters more than helping the US federal government make the nation stronger and safer and life better for people. Our 13,000+ people are united in a shared purpose to pursue the limitless potential of technology and ingenuity for clients across defense, national security, public safety, civilian, and military health organizations.
Join Accenture Federal Services to do the work you love in an inclusive, collaborative, and caring community, where you can be empowered to grow, learn and thrive through hands-on experience, certifications, industry training and more.
Join us to drive positive, lasting change that moves missions and the government forward!

Job Description:
AFS is seeking a Business Analyst to analyze an organization and design its processes and systems, assessing the business model and its integration with technology. The Business Analyst will assess current state, identify customer requirements, and define the future state and/or business solution. They will be responsible to research, gather and synthesize information. There will be up to 50% CONUS/OCONUS travel.
Here's what you need:
8+ years of all-source intelligence analyst experience at the full performance level, with 5+ years working for or with USSOCOM SOF or national level intelligence agencies
3+ years experience with:
Knowledge in intelligence support to special operations
writing formal finished intelligence assessments (e.g., white papers, targeting packages, or other serialized finished intelligence products)
Utilizing basic computer applications and current SIGINT related databases to support analytical efforts and product development in support of operations
Utilizing current intelligence related automation, applications, tools, and databases to support analytical efforts and product development
Working with the current suite of all-source intelligence tools
Preparing and delivering intelligence briefings at the Colonel (O-6) / GS-15 level or higher
Must have or obtain a U.S. passport within 30 days of employment
Bonus points if you have:
Expert knowledge of SOF and or CT intelligence experience
Strong briefing skills and be capable of effectively directing and influencing the conduct of SIGINT operations
Superior proficiency, knowledge, understanding, and experience with current all-source analytical techniques, theory, methodologies, processes, and trends
Strong background and firsthand experience in SIGINT Analysis, SIGINT systems, tools, and databases, reporting and collection management
Security Clearance:
Must have an active TS/SCI security clearance
What We Believe
We have an unwavering commitment to diversity with the aim that every one of our people has a full sense of belonging within our organization. As a business imperative, every person at Accenture Federal Services has the responsibility to create and sustain an inclusive environment.
Inclusion and diversity are fundamental to our culture and core values. Our rich diversity makes us more innovative and more creative, which helps us better serve our clients and our communities. Read more here
Equal Employment Opportunity Statement
Accenture Federal Services is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We believe that no one should be discriminated against because of their differences, such as age, disability, ethnicity, gender, gender identity and expression, religion or sexual orientation.
All employment decisions shall be made without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, citizenship status or any other basis as protected by federal, state, or local law.
Accenture is committed to providing veteran employment opportunities to our service men and women.
For details, view a copy of the Accenture Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Policy Statement.

Los Angeles County Information Only
If you live in or expect to work from Los Angeles County if hired for this position, please review below for important additional information.

Criminal history may have a direct, adverse, and negative relationship with some of the material job duties of this position. These include the duties and responsibilities listed in the job posting, as well as the abilities to adhere to company policies, exercise sound judgment, effectively manage stress and work safely and respectfully with others, exhibit trustworthiness, meet client expectations, standards, and accompanying requirements, and safeguard business operations and company reputation. Pursuant to the California Fair Chance Act, Los Angeles County Fair Chance Ordinance for Employers, Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance, and San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Requesting An Accommodation
Accenture Federal Services is committed to providing equal employment opportunities for persons with disabilities or religious observances, including reasonable accommodation when needed. If you are hired by Accenture Federal Services and require accommodation to perform the essential functions of your role, you will be asked to participate in our reasonable accommodation process. Accommodations made to facilitate the recruiting process are not a guarantee of future or continued accommodations once hired.
If you are being considered for employment opportunities with Accenture Federal Services and need an accommodation for a disability or religious observance during the interview process or for the job you are interviewing for, please speak with your recruiter.
Other Employment Statements
Applicants for employment in the US must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States.
Candidates who are currently employed by a client of Accenture Federal Services or an affiliated Accenture business may not be eligible for consideration.
Job candidates will not be obligated to disclose sealed or expunged records of conviction or arrest as part of the hiring process.
The Company will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. Additionally, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the Company's legal duty to furnish information.

description:
Overview:
About Public Consulting Group
Public Consulting Group LLC (PCG) is a leading public sector solutions implementation and operations improvement firm that partners with health, education, and human services agencies to improve lives. Founded in 1986, PCG employs approximately 2,500 professionals throughout the U.S.—all committed to delivering solutions that change lives for the better. The firm is a member of a family of companies with experience in all 50 states, clients in six Canadian provinces and Europe. PCG offers clients a multidisciplinary approach to meet challenges, pursue opportunities, and serve constituents across the public sector. To learn more, visit www.publicconsultinggroup.com.
Responsibilities:
Responsibilities:
Conduct competitive research and analysis, including gathering and analyzing competitor proposals and contracts

Conduct client research and analysis, including client initiatives, budgets, and relationship mapping

Monitor federal agency sites for new regulations, initiatives, and directives


Conduct research on industry thought leadership
Other research as needed

Sales Team Support

Enter and update sales team data in the pipeline system and generate executive dashboard reports

Support proposal development activities, including but not limited to:


Support development of proposal outlines

Develop basic proposal template from outline

Building proposals from content library and automation tools

Communicate with bid partners, including sending bid packages and managing partner responses (resumes, section content, pricing sheets, forms, etc)

Manage required forms and corporate attachments

Creating proposal compliance matrix (from template) and conducting compliance review as directed

Support capture activities, including monitorin RFx sites, gathering press and insights related to pipeline contracts, and sending external communications

Update sales PPT decks as directed

Submit FOIA requests

Other sales team support activities as needed


Qualifications:
Required Skills
Excellent written communication skills.
Exceptional organization and project management skills.
Creative problem-solving ability and a consultancy mindset.
Flexible, self-starter possessing intellectual curiosity.
Dedication to accomplishing goals and challenges presented by our businesses and management.
Ability to move multiple engagements forward while working at a detailed level.
Ability to interact with various levels of management including executives and directors.
Ability to follow, critically evaluate, and improve upon current processes.
Ability to set, track, and monitor quantitative goals and practice data driven decision making.
Demonstrated expertise in MS Office products, particularly SharePoint, PowerPoint, Excel, and Teams.
Qualifications
BS or BA degree required
5+ years of related experience
Experience in public sector sales enablement or business / data analysis
Must have thorough understanding of business development lifecycle, including RFPs and proposals
Exceptional critical thinking and analytical skills
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Strong self-initiative and ability to work independently
Strong interpersonal skills

Remote Work Statement
This position is a remote, work from home position. PCG is a remote-friendly organization and is committed to creating a culture where remote work remains a vital part of the company’s success. To be successful in a remote work role at PCG, you must:
be available during your set working hours.
have a safe, private, and distraction-free environment in which to complete your work, and
be able to give your full attention to the completion of your PCG job duties.
Some travel to the office or elsewhere may be required for team meetings, client meetings, etc.
We are accepting applications on an ongoing basis until filled.
Compensation:
Compensation for roles at Public Consulting Group varies depending on a wide array of factors including, but not limited to, the specific office location, role, skill set, and level of experience. As required by applicable law, PCG provides the following reasonable range of compensation for this role: $60,000 - $85,000. In addition, PCG provides a range of benefits for this role..
EEO Statement:
Public Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer dedicated to celebrating diversity and intentionally creating a culture of inclusion. We believe that we work best when our employees feel empowered and accepted, and that starts by honoring each of our unique life experiences. At PCG, all aspects of employment regarding recruitment, hiring, training, promotion, compensation, benefits, transfers, layoffs, return from layoff, company-sponsored training, education, and social and recreational programs are based on merit, business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion or belief, national, social, or ethnic origin, sex, gender identity and/or expression, age, physical, mental, or sensory disability, sexual orientation, marital, civil union, or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, citizenship status, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law. PCG will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. PCG believes in health, equality, and prosperity for everyone so we can succeed in changing the ways the public sector, including health, education, technology and human services industries, work.
title: Business Analyst

benefits: 401(k) matching,Health
description:
The role:
The HR Business Analyst role is a techno-functional business-facing role, accountable for establishing and maintaining the value driven relationship between EIS and Human Resources with the objective of making the business successful. Supports alignment between EIS and assigned functional area(s) and helps balance expectations, priorities, service levels, and investment. Recommends state of the market solutions and collaborates with the business to develop the applications roadmap for the supported area. Collaborates with technology architects to create a portfolio of services to meet business requirements. Develops business cases for strategic projects, is responsible for project management of appropriate projects and/or participating as a team member to ensure successful project execution. Manages other third-party service delivery resources.
At Kao, we offer amazing benefits that are available to you on your first day of employment (healthcare, 401(k) plus company match, etc.), 36 total days off (vacation + holidays + sick) and a reasonable salary range of $80,000 - $90,000. We also offer a hybrid work schedule.
What you will do:
Workday Integrations
Design, develop, and implement Workday integration solutions to meet business needs and requirements.
Define and document Workday integration standards, guidelines, and best practices. Monitor and maintain Workday integrations to ensure optimal performance and reliability.
Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to Workday integrations. Provide technical leadership and guidance in Workday implementation projects involving integrations.
Facilitate/Coordinate integration testing between third party support team, HCD business teams, and vendor.
Business Relationship Management
Understand the strategic imperatives, business capabilities, operating model, issues, and IT needs of assigned business areas.
Maintain and nurture customer relationships to manage demand, identify requirements, and support the delivery of solutions.
Service Provider Management & Ensuring Outstanding Business
Ensure 3rd party team members provide outstanding day-to-day application support (break fix and periodic "releases") working within defined SLA metrics and manage issues to completion.
Willingness to be “on call” and provide support outside normal business hours with occasional domestic and international travel.
This will involve key focus on day-to-day management of 3rd party service providers to ensure quality, attainment of SLA's, and successful project execution.
Project Management and Execution
Accountable for successful execution of major application projects including communication with key executives, budget management, and coordination of 3rd party resources.
Business Application Roadmaps & HCD Portfolio Management.
Lead cross-functional workshops with business teams to understand application benefits and pain points; engage EIS architects, business members, industry experts, and perform research in establishing best in class application options; partner with Kao business, including senior to executive leadership, in charting the course for all technology in a functional area over a three-year period including strategic, tactical, and new technology options.
Engage with executive leadership to understand strategic objectives and priorities. Lead meetings with business stakeholders to drive prioritization and successful delivery of the full technology portfolio in enabling an area’s strategic objectives. This includes recurring engagement with senior leadership, identifying internal and external teams to drive the projects, developing creative solutions to overcome challenges, and keeping large numbers of senior leaders and stakeholders aligned in delivering the portfolio.
What you will need:
Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related field.
4+ years prior CPG experience in business analysis, Workday, project management, or a related field is highly valued.
Workday experience required.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to assess business needs and resolve complex issues.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, as the role involves interacting with various stakeholders and documenting requirements. Good interpersonal skills to effectively liaise between technical teams and business stakeholders.
Knowledge of project management principles and practices. Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and work under tight deadlines.
How we work: Having been selected among the World´s Most Ethical Companies for 18 consecutive years, we are a company with a purpose and strong corporate values. We never compromise on quality and craft our products with care for the consumer and the environment. At Kao, each employee can actively shape their job and their career. We work collaboratively to achieve our common goals, always aiming to deliver the best for our customers.
What we offer: A friendly and flexible work environment with competitive salaries, benefits package, ongoing development and the opportunity to enhance your skills and deliver tangible results. At Kao your voice will be heard. Your opinion really counts. We believe that change comes from taking opportunities into your own hands, so we value and reward entrepreneurial thinking and innovation.
Hiring Process: Kao embraces the diversity and the individual personalities of its people because we believe it is diversity that makes us strong. This is why we welcome applications from all areas of the global community.
Want to learn more: If you feel you are as unique as our products and want to find out why 33,000 people across the globe opted for a career with us please visit our Americas website (https://www.kao.com/americas/en/).
EOE, including disability/vets
title: Business Analyst

description:
The IT Business Analyst Supervisor is responsible for business analyst project work related to planning, coordinating, and overseeing team requirements, solution design, UAT, implementation, and support of IT solutions. Maintains an understanding of the active projects and workload of the team, including policies, business drivers, current system issues, and additional system needs, etc. Supervises the day-to-day work of business analysts, to implement system solutions.
Your Impact:
Collaborate with end-users of all ITS solutions and services to identify technical, functional, and process-based system improvements and optimization.
Work closely with ITS Management on the delivery of system projects and releases, including but not limited to new business implementation and major system upgrades.
Document system and end-user requirements and deliver to the software application development team, acting as the bridge between the business and IT throughout the process to ensure software application development solutions meet business needs.
Create and/or update functional systems documentation for existing systems; define and document business rules and use cases.
Provide feedback to Information Technology Services (ITS) Management on how to continually improve ITS processes.
Provide oversight, regular updates, and be a point of escalation to ITS Management on progress/status of assigned projects or initiatives.
Supervisory Responsibility - Responsible for immediate supervision of assigned ITS team members through all the following –
Overseeing day-to-day assignments and tasks of direct reports.
Building healthy relationships with direct reports to drive team culture and assist with their career development through mentorship, supervision, and expertise.
Evaluate performance of direct reports and provide feedback on a regular basis.
Successful Candidates Will Have:
Bachelor’s degree in business, business analysis, project management, operations, or a related field.
5+ years of experience in a business analysis or similar role and 2+ years of experience in team lead and/or supervisory role.
Strong demonstrated skills in the following areas – mentorship, supervision, leadership, problem-solving, logic applied critical thinking, and interfacing with members at all levels of the organization.
Proven ability in the following –
learn technical and functionality concepts quickly with a high level of retention.
communicate technical and functionality concepts verbally and in writing.
organize and prioritize workload with multiple projects and deadlines.
work well under pressure in a fast-paced environment.
handle frequent and random changes understanding when building custom software nothing is 100% predictable.
One80 Intermediaries is a privately held firm with offices throughout the US and Canada. As a leading insurance wholesaler and program manager, One80 offers placement services and binding authority for property and casualty, life, travel/accident and health, affinity and administrative services, and warranty business. Launched just four years ago, One80 Intermediaries has grown to be one of the largest intermediaries in the United States. In 2022, Business Insurance ranked One80 as the 5th Largest MGA/Underwriting Manager/Lloyd’s Coverholder, and 5th Largest Underwriting Manager in the country.
At One80 Intermediaries, base pay is one part of our total compensation package, which also includes a comprehensive suite of benefits, including medical, dental, vision, disability, life, and retirement savings, and 10 days of paid time off and 11 paid holidays for eligible employees. The total compensation for a position may also include other elements dependent on the position offered. The expected annual pay range for this position is between $80,000 to $100,000 plus discretionary bonus. The actual base pay offered may vary depending on multiple individualized factors, including geographical location, education, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience.

description:
Let Us Power Your Potential
Taylor Corporation is a dynamic, diversified company with big plans for the future ― and your career. We power our employees’ potential and strive to create opportunity and security for every member of the team. If you’re ready for something bigger ― more challenge, more variety, more pathways for professional growth ― we should talk. We’re passionate about our work, we believe there is always a better way, and we’re looking for people like you.
Ready to reach your potential? It’s time to look at Taylor.
Your Opportunity: Taylor Corporation is looking for a Business Analyst to join the Enterprise Transformation team who brings strong Oracle ERP background to the table.

Your Responsibilities:
Requirement Gathering/Continuous Improvement
Work with SME’s within the business to analyze current operational procedures, identify areas for improvement and offer possible solutions
Facilitate the gathering, analysis, prioritization, and complexity categorization of business requirements
Document and model ‘as is’ and ‘future state’ business processes. Analyze and optimize requirements to match guiding principles of future state
Effectively and efficiently organize and facilitate interviews and workshops
Communicate and translate requirements effectively between business areas and IT
Review technology capabilities and workflows to determine if program and system changes are possible
Assist with preparation of time and cost estimates for completing project deliverables
Assist with ROI analysis for defined solutions
Act as a liaison between business end users, IT development teams, Oracle support and/or consulting resources. Consultant on analysis, design, configuration, testing and maintenance to ensure optimal operational performance
Responsible for collaborating with the business to create detailed use cases, process flows, prototyping, test cases and test scenarios to implement quality solutions
Testing
Participate in and lead testing activities, providing input into test plans, writing test scripts and test cases
Facilitate and direct testing defect tracking and reporting as needed
Responsible for managing, creating and executing test cases and scenarios
Lead the quarterly update testing and facilitate of updates to all BU
System Maintenance
Mange the configuration of the Oracle Cloud applications, understanding up and downstream impacts
Analyze and troubleshoot the Oracle Cloud functional issues and manage communications to business units as well as vendor if needed
Lead the recurring release process, partnering with SME’s to validate functionality and sign off
Provision application user access
Support
Support the SMEs through training of rollouts or new changes
Level 3 support for Help Desk issues resolution
Support error resolution process for integrations and workflows
Other
Participate in acquisitions
Key member of Oracle system projects
Lead future rollouts of new modules
Provide organizational change management for new changes, additions, or eliminations to process/system
Assist project teams in defining project scope, goals, approach and deliverables supporting the business objectives

You Must Have:
Bachelor degree – in Finance/Accounting, Information Systems, or related discipline or the equivalent in training and experience
6+ years of experience working as an Oracle Financials Functional Subject Matter Expert, with Oracle Fusion Cloud applications experience a plus
Specific expertise in the following Oracle modules: Projects (management, billing and costing), integration to Vertex for sales and use tax
Specific experience in configuration of Vertex tax calculation
We Would Also Prefer:
Strong foundation in accounting and finance concepts
Innovative and detail oriented
Change agent, willing to challenge the status quo
Knowledgeable in designing and constructing business processes and their links to technology
Strong communication and facilitation skills
Good planning and organizing skills
Good project management skills

About Taylor Corporation
One of the largest graphics communications firms in North America, Taylor’s family of companies provide a diverse set of products, services, and technologies addressing the toughest communication challenges. For nearly 50 years, Taylor has been a premier provider of powerful and innovative products, services, and expertise for individuals, businesses, and distributors large and small. Our 10,000+ employees spanning 26 states and seven countries work diligently to create the interactive, printing, and marketing solutions that have helped build some of the world’s more recognizable brands. Everything we do begins with identifying the unique priorities and needs of our customers and creating one-of-a-kind solutions. We offer a comprehensive benefit package including several health plans to choose from, dental, vision, wellness programs, life and disability coverage, flexible spending accounts, health savings accounts, 401(k) plan with company match, paid time off (PTO) and 64 hours of annual holiday pay.

The Employer retains the right to change or assign other duties to this position.

Taylor Corporation is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.
Taylor Corporation including all partners and affiliates is an Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disabled.

description:
At PriMed, your uniqueness is valued, celebrated, encouraged, supported, and embraced. Whatever your relationship with Hill Physicians, we welcome ALL that you are.
We value and respect your race, ethnicity, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, religion, disabilities, experiences, perspectives, and other attributes. Our celebration of diversity and foundation of inclusion allows us to leverage our differences and capitalize on our similarities to better serve our communities. We do it because it's right!
This position is a hybrid two day a week on-site in our Sacramento, California corporate office.
The Utilization Management Business Analyst will serve as a critical link between our Authorizations operations and IT teams, focusing on optimizing the utilization management workflows within the Epic system. This role will analyze business processes, design solutions, and support the implementation and maintenance of the Epic Utilization Management module to enhance operational efficiencies and ensure compliance with regulatory requirements. This role will report to Manager, Authorizations Business Product Management.
This is an operations position not IT, requirement Epic certification.
Essential responsibilities:
System Support: First tier support for Utilization Management team and integrated team workflows with, Compliance, Contracting, Concurrent review, Enrollment, Claims, Customer Services, Regional Services and Provider data teams. Route and track complex issues, system configuration requests to IT and other teams as necessary.
Analysis & Solutioning: Conduct analysis for issues identified. Intake enhancement requests and recommend potential system solutions.
Requirements gathering: Gather business requirements from necessary business stakeholders. Secure leadership approval of the requirements and system workflow/design as necessary.
Testing: Point person for all testing needs for system updates – Operational changes, enhancements, reports, and projects.
Key operational reports: Generate and distribute reports using Epic Reporting Workbench (RWB) for UM Leadership and Compliance Audits. Perform necessary data analysis to present summaries and recommendations relevant to the audience. Collaborate with Informatics team for complex reports, dashboards.
System adoption: Distribute announcements for system updates and participate in system demonstration, training content creation as necessary. Coordinate to ensure operationalization of system workflow changes working with internal and external stakeholders.
Adjudication Rules: Own adjudication rules monitoring, maintenance, and identify opportunities to improve auto approval rate in Tapestry, in collaboration with Business and IT Teams.
Codes maintenance: Own procedure codes and code levels maintenance, in collaboration with Business and IT Teams.
Codes analysis: Participate in analysis and present recommendations for codes monitoring and outliers identified by Informatics team(s)
Workflow optimizations: Own integrated UM workflows in Tapestry, in collaboration with Business and IT Teams
Work queues: Own WQ routing and maintenance, in collaboration with Business and IT Teams
IT Project participation: Participate in Epic IT projects representing the department, mitigating potential risks to Utilization Management team KPIs – Electronic adjudication (EA) rate, Turnaround time (TAT) compliance and pending work queue volumes.
Data Governance: Participate in Data Governance stewardship meetings and initiatives representing -Utilization Management team to identify and solve for the team’s data needs.
Skills and Experience:
Epic Tapestry UM/CM or other related modules certification required.
A minimum of 3 years of experience with Epic Reporting Workbench required.
A minimum of 3 years of experience as Business/Systems Analyst or similar position required.
Demonstrated ability to elicit, analyze and communicate business requirements effectively.
Ability and willingness to build positive relationships with internal and external teams.
Excellent communication, critical and analytical thinking, and problem-solving skills.
Ability to exercise good judgment and prioritize multiple tasks.
Ability to work independently, showing initiative and being pro-active.
Proficient with MS Office: Excel, Outlook, Word, Teams and PowerPoint.

description:

Job Description
We are FIS. Our technology powers the world’s economy and our teams bring innovation to life. We champion diversity to deliver the best products and solutions for our colleagues, clients and communities. If you’re ready to start learning, growing and making an impact with a career in fintech, we’d like to know: Are you FIS?
About the team
Our team comprises a diverse group of talented individuals, each brings unique skills and perspective to the team. Our team includes seasoned employees who bring extensive experience and expertise, yet we are eager to welcome fresh perspectives and innovative ideas. We have a collaborative environment that drives innovation and fosters continual learning. We share a passion for pushing boundaries and solving complex problems. Together we embrace challenges, celebrate successes, and cultivate a supportive atmosphere where everyone can thrive and contribute their best.
Our team is currently focused on a critical transition that will shape our future pricing strategy and operational efficiency. we are in the process of moving from our inhouse custom designed application Pricing Tool to a new CPQ (Configure, Price, Quote) system to facilitate our organizations Future Forward goals.
What you will be doing
Your role will be multifaceted and critical to the Pricing Development team.
Work closely with Stakeholders including Product Owners, management and technical team to understand their needs and gather requirements.
Document functional and non-functional requirements clearly and comprehensively ensuring they are agreed upon by stakeholders.
Analyse existing business processes to identify areas of improvement, inefficiencies and opportunities to automate.
You’ll be responsible for conducting in-depth analysis, planning, overseeing, and managing multiple large and/or complex projects to create specification documents for development.
You will collaborate closely with cross -functional teams implement solutions.
Your expertise will be instrumental in guiding strategic decision making and drive innovation and foster improvements.
Evaluate the functionality of new product releases and present and give details of the project to the stakeholders.
What you will need:
Minimum of 2 Years of recent experience with Oracle CPQ
2+ years of experience testing CPQ updates during CPQ migration against existing Inhouse tool to ensure all aspects have been migrated accurately before releasing into production
2+ years of experience testing the development codes based on Product Owner requirements from the specification documents.
Proven track record at least 5 years’ experience in business analysis, able to demonstrate a deep understanding of business processes.
Ability to analyze complex business problems, identify the root causes and develop innovative solutions.
Proficiency in a range of computing skills (full suite of Microsoft Office products: Word, Excel (advanced create formulas), Outlook, PowerPoint, SharePoint, Power BI (queries and reports), Publisher Web Conferencing
Attention to detail, Problem-solving capabilities and the ability to make decisions
Ability to readily identify requirements and scope out relevant negative/positive scenarios at every stage of the process as well as identify opportunities needing correction.
The ability to work within a team and independently with minimal supervision.
Added bonus if you have:
Six Sigma or Lean
Strong Leadership or Project Managing abilities.
What we offer you:
A career at FIS is more than just a job. It’s the change to shape the future of fintech. At FIS, we offer you:
A voice in the future of fintech
Always-on learning and development
Collaborative work environment
Opportunities to give back
Competitive salary and benefits

FIS is committed to providing its employees with an exciting career opportunity and competitive compensation. The pay range for this full-time position is $84,720.00 - $142,320.00 and reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries for this position based on the posted role, level, and location. Within the range, actual individual starting pay is determined additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Any changes in work location will also impact actual individual starting pay. Please consult with your recruiter about the specific salary range for your preferred location during the hiring process.
Privacy Statement
FIS is committed to protecting the privacy and security of all personal information that we process in order to provide services to our clients. For specific information on how FIS protects personal information online, please see the Online Privacy Notice.
EEOC Statement
FIS is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, genetic information, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other protected characteristics. The EEO is the Law poster is available here supplement document available here

For positions located in the US, the following conditions apply. If you are made a conditional offer of employment, you will be required to undergo a drug test. However, for Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) purposes, the essential functions of the job may or may not have been described for purposes of ADA reasonable accommodation. All reasonable accommodation requests will be reviewed and evaluated on a case-by-case basis.
Sourcing Model
Recruitment at FIS works primarily on a direct sourcing model; a relatively small portion of our hiring is through recruitment agencies. FIS does not accept resumes from recruitment agencies which are not on the preferred supplier list and is not responsible for any related fees for resumes submitted to job postings, our employees, or any other part of our company.

job_title: Sr Technical Business Analyst in Azure DevOps
description:
- (3305096)

As a not-for-profit organization, Mass General Brigham is committed to supporting patient care, research, teaching, and service to the community by leading innovation across our system. Founded by Brigham and Women’s Hospital and Massachusetts General Hospital, Mass General Brigham supports a complete continuum of care including community and specialty hospitals, a managed care organization, a physician network, community health centers, home care, and other health-related entities. Several of our hospitals are teaching affiliates of Harvard Medical School, and our system is a national leader in biomedical research.
We’re focused on a people-first culture for our system’s patients and our professional family. That’s why we provide our employees with more ways to achieve their potential. Mass General Brigham is committed to aligning our employees’ personal aspirations with projects that match their capabilities and creating a culture that empowers our managers to become trusted mentors. We support each member of our team to own their personal development—and we recognize success at every step.
Our employees use the Mass General Brigham values to govern decisions, actions, and behaviors. These values guide how we get our work done: Patients, Affordability, Accountability & Service Commitment, Decisiveness, Innovation & Thoughtful Risk; and how we treat each other: Diversity & Inclusion, Integrity & Respect, Learning, Continuous Improvement & Personal Growth, Teamwork & Collaboration.
The Opportunity:
At Mass General Brigham Digital, we pride ourselves on our ability to create maximum strategic, clinical, and operational value from established and emergent technologies for our patients, care teams, researchers, and employees. Digital health will not only enhance the equity and efficiency of healthcare delivery, but it will also help make medicine more personalized and precise.
We recognize that increasing value and continually improving quality while maintaining an inclusive focus are essential to organizational excellence, and we invite you to join us on this journey. The work we do in Digital is a strategic imperative, and there is a strong and growing understanding of how together we will transform Mass General Brigham in innovative and impactful ways.
We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Technical Business Analyst to join our Azure DevOps team. The ideal candidate will bridge the gap between IT and business operations, leveraging Azure DevOps to improve processes and drive efficiency. As a Technical Business Analyst, you will play a critical role in ensuring that our software development projects are delivered on time, within budget, and meet the needs of our customers. You will work closely with cross-functional teams, including development, testing, and operations, to analyze business requirements and develop solutions that balance customer requirements with organizational policies and standards.
This is a technology SME position that requires hands-on process development and implementation within a fast-moving, agile group that interacts with and supports research and development activities in the enterprise. The unifying characteristics of the position are a well-grounded, hands-on understanding of the Software Development Lifecycle including best practices around Software Quality Assurance, an understanding of systems integration and automation, an eagerness to learn quickly, develop robust support models in an agile/flexible manner, and apply new technologies and services. A deep motivation to work with and enable cutting-edge on-prem and cloud-based projects, ability to work independently to meet deadlines, outstanding customer service skills, and the ability to help teams and projects successfully accomplish their objectives is a must. Ideal candidates thrive on variety and innovation in their daily work, on interaction with customers who are world-renowned leaders in their fields and working with a wide range of technologies in a decentralized non-standard environment.
Principal Duties and Responsibilities:
Conduct business process analyses, return on investment (ROI) analyses and needs assessments to align Azure DevOps solutions with business initiatives.
Work closely with development, testing and operations teams to implement DevOps practices and tools including CI/CD.
Develop and maintain project dashboards and reports to track progress and performance.
Collaborate with testing teams to ensure that software solutions meet quality and testing standards.
Occasionally lead testing efforts for ADO Feature updates and extension validation as well as home grown utilities and workflow automation.
Create and maintain technical documentation for Azure DevOps processes and best practices.
Provide demonstrations of Azure DevOps features and workflows to stakeholders.
Develop and deliver training programs on Azure DevOps tools and methodologies for technical and non-technical staff.
Manage and document project migrations within ADO as well as from external platforms such as JIRA, GitLab and other.
Working Conditions:
The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job.
This position requires occasional local travel to MGB sites, vendors, and/or conferences
Hospital work environment working conditions include possible exposure to diseases or infections and may require safety gear (PPE) such as gloves and mask.
Normal office working conditions. The noise level in the work environment is quiet to moderate.
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to sit; talk; or hear; use hands to finger; handle; or feel; reach with hands and arms. The employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; and stoop; kneel; or crouch. The employee must frequently lift and/or move up to 5 pounds and occasionally lift and/or move up to 20 pounds.
Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision and depth perception.
On-call coverage expected as business needs dictate.

Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Information Technology, Healthcare, or a related field required; Master’s degree preferred.
Eight or more years of healthcare information technology experience with knowledge of clinical systems.
Strong knowledge of Azure DevOps, including Azure Boards, Repos, Pipelines, and Test Plans.
Excellent understanding of Agile and DevOps methodologies.
Experience with requirements elicitation, gap analysis, and process modeling.
Proficiency in using tools like MS Project, Visio, JIRA, and collaboration platforms.
Strong communication and presentation skills for effective training delivery.
Ability to translate complex technical concepts into easy-to-understand language for various audiences.
Epic Certification desired or must obtain Epic training as outlined by program requirement
A combination of education and experience may be substituted for requirements
Skills/Abilities/Competencies:
Certifications in Azure DevOps, Scrum, or ITIL preferred.
Familiarity with programming concepts and version control systems and scripting languages such as Python and Javascript.
Knowledge of CI/CD pipelines and automated testing practices.
Experience with project management tools and methodologies (e.g. MS Project, Asana, Jira)
Experience with cloud-based technologies (e.g. Azure, AWS, Google Cloud)
Knowledge of DevOps practices and tools (e.g. Docker, Kubernetes, Jenkins)
Experience with testing and quality assurance methodologies (e.g. Test-Driven Development, Behavior-Driven Development)

EEO Statement

Mass General Brigham is an Equal Opportunity Employer. By embracing diverse skills, perspectives, and ideas, we choose to lead. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religious creed, national origin, sex, age, gender identity, disability, sexual orientation, military service, genetic information, and/or other status protected under the law. We will ensure that all individuals with a disability are provided a reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, perform essential job functions, and receive other benefits and privileges of employment.

Work Locations MGB Assembly Row 399 Revolution Drive Somerville 02145

Schedule Full-time
Standard Hours 40
Shift Day Job
Employee Status Regular
